name: Columbus Museum of Art
address: 480 E Broad St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: Not a huge museum, but definitely has some interesting pieces to checkout. The employees were extremely friendly and awesome to chat with and discuss the artworks with. I had a really wonderful time here and enjoyed this museum a lot. The sculpture garden was really beautiful and perfect for warm weather. Definitely recommend.

Small, but neat collection with emphasis on modern art and art of African American experience. The atrium with skylight is a breathtakingly beautiful space. I loved the idea of calling the number using my own phone to hear about the most prominent art pieces. However, the narration sounded like a voice mail that wasn't prepared or rehearsed.

In years past I did not particularly enjoy this Museum because it was mainly portraits of dead people that were dark and without character or emotion. That era is gone now. The displays I saw recently were varied, lively, and interesting. The glass works in particular were amazing and the suspended Barrel it's always moving. The best part about the visit was to see all of the interactive opportunities that draw in all ages but especially young people and children. It would be wonderful if the funding for the museum was such that they were able to have other occasions with free admission has the Sunday I was there it was packed. There is a demand for this amongst those who don't have the pocketbook for it.

For a small museum it's very well maintained and the calendar of exhibits are wonderful. Definitely worth a visit but have a look at their website to see what is currently featured. After your tour of the exhibits take a break and enjoy the cafe. Since it's change a few years ago it's become a fantastic place for lunch! It faces the sculpture garden and it's a fantastic way to while away the afternoon. The food is delicious and the view is inspiring.

The museum is a nice place to come and enjoy the beauty that others have created. There is much diversity with the types of art on display. It is also very nice to come on Sunday's when it is free admission. It also has a very nice gift shop as well. Oh, and the architecture itself in the building is beautiful also!

name: John F. Wolfe Columbus Commons
address: 160 S High St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: I visited with my Glambaby around Christmas🎅🏽🤶🏼. This  was put together nice. A beautiful scenery of Christmas 🎄⛄lights. The Merry go round was closed because we arrived late. We enjoyed it even though it was really🌡️🌧️☄️

Great centralized park, with a nice holiday light display for a relaxing stroll. Portable toilets are available and there is plenty of areas to just sit and relax. The central field does get muddy at times, so be aware when you choose footwear

This place is amazingly beautiful, it is safe to ventured day and night. Security is visible at all times, decorations are beautiful and it always clean. The area is small but it worth visiting. It would be awesome if they let volunteered sing or put free music at night.

They have awesome stuff happening down there! It's Christmas time right now and my children really enjoyed the lights, free hot chocolate, free train ride, and free carousel ride. They also had face painting, ballons, and Santa. During the summer they also have free concerts and events as well. I'd  highly recommend this place.

It is beautiful this time of year..it's a must see. Go see the lights and kids can ride the carousel and run in the field. There were also amazing carolers to get you in the Christmas spirit.  A nice space.

name: Schiller Park
address: 1069 Jaeger St, Columbus, OH 43206, USA
reviews: Cool park in the middle of German village. Great place to walk around. There's a parking lot that would hold about 30 cars on site and street parking around the border. There is a playground, a pond, a stage for theatrical performances and a bunch of shade trees. A few Pokemon gyms as well if you're into Pokemon go. It's not big, probably a 20min walk around the outside, but the surrounding community is nice to walk around as well, especially if you are into architecture.

We absolutely love this hidden gem in the middle of German Village. We take walks there as often as we can. During the summer we occasionally take a blanket to spread out under a tree and just enjoy the park views and the people. This park is also very pet friendly. We have also been told the pond provides a good fishing experience for children.
Amazing park, quite and peaceful. The park hosts free outdoor theater sometimes during the warm season. You can bring your own food and chair to watch the show.

Fairly expansive green space in old German village.  Great contemplation pond and overall well maintained grounds.  The park is frequented by lots of dog walkers about.  The long running summer en plein air theater hosted here is a tremendous contribution to Columbus' arts situation.

It’s worth seeing this statue at least once. Around the statue is a brief story about the statue and the German community here in Columbus. Not to mention a stroll through Schiller park is just what I need sometimes to relax and enjoy the day.

name: Topiary Park
address: 480 E Town St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews:
This is one of my favorites stops in Columbus.  It is great to see in all seasons.  Steamy hot summers.  Those cool fall nights while an outdoor movie is playing on the large inflatable screen.  The middle of winter when the snow is covering everything.  Or just like yesterday, January 1, a cold, but clear day.  

Tons of squirrels running around most of the year.  Lots of birds in the good weather months.
It's a beautiful park. Super impressive and a very creative idea. I was really impressed. Plus the library next to it is AMAZING. I would love to go back when or if it ever gets sunny/warm.

Very pleasant place to walk near the heart of the city.  It is fun to see a painting brought to life. We realized more deeply this time unlike the painting of Sunday in the Park you can change the perspective.  Moving around and viewing it from different angles changes the experience.
Nice little park in downtown that's really well kept all year round. Next to a library and a high school!
Went out of season would probably look amazing in the summer time

name: Scioto Mile Promenade
address: 233 S Civic Center Dr, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: It's such a lovely area now with growing shade trees. We took our dog and teenagers for a picnic and it was so nice. It seems to be all open when you walk along the several levels of sidewalks, but when you settle in a grassy area, it feels like you have your own yard with neighbors walking by.
Clean, nice and long beautiful trail that leads to a wetland in one direction. I love the beauty I often encounter
Absolutely gorgeous and very well maintained. An incredible asset to downtown. Super convenient for lunchtime strolls, jogging, etc. Very accessible - lots of ramp entrances in multiple locations.

Absolutely gorgeous and a joy to visit! My family loves walking downtown and seeing everything they can, and they're always building onto parks and building new parks and other places o  a regular basis, so you won't get tired of going; trust me, it's hard to keep a childs attention, but our crew of kids are 4, 8, 8, 9, 10 & 12... And they're NEVER bored of being down there!! Great places to have a picnic or just relax under a tree with a book
Relaxing.  Great area to walk, run, ride bikes. Lots of benches to sit and reflect. Porch swings. Beautiful view of downtown.  Great vibe. Splash pad for the kids 2 play in the water.

name: Bicentennial Park
address: 233 S Civic Center Dr, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: This is my favorite place to ride my bike in Columbus. It’s about more than just any one element, it’s about the possibility of the unknown that might be new every time. Of course, you can people watch, take in the views, relax & just sit back on the banks of the river & chill. The views & sites are beautiful & amazing, personally I’ve stopped to watch skaters filming tricks using the unique structures (a few times), toddlers playing & discovering the awesome effects of the water fountain, girls row teams embarking & disembarking from the river, photographers with their modals, runners in races... the possibilities are endless depending on the path you choose & the time you take.  Not to mention the 229 restaurant with it’s fabulous food, views & lite easy vibe.

Beautiful scenery great paths to walk and admire the skyline and river. Looks amazing at night time but be careful out there! Only complaint is there is ABSOLUTELY no restrooms. They have locked bathrooms 24 hours a day, so don't waste your time walking all the way to them!

Had a great time working on a photography project at Bicentennial Park. Love this park! Great for kids and adults alike. Plenty of shops if you like that, me? I’d rather be here relaxing at the park with my dog Lexie.
This area is just one of the better places in Ohio I may say. I would love to spend lots of time here if I had it. Would be perfect for like even just a date.

What a beautiful Park located in the heart of it all. This was my first time visiting this location and I could not be more impressed. I came down to the area to put my paddle board into the river and paddle around and I was very impressed with how easily accessible the Waterway was and how beautifully clean the area is being kept. This location is very easy to get to, clean, and I felt very safe. The views were spectacular especially from the water and I really enjoyed my day. I highly recommend this location to others and I will definitely be back again.

name: Center of Science and Industry
address: 333 W Broad St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: Went to COSI after dark and it was pretty amazing.  The lines were a little long for food and drink so prep before hand.  It was great to drop being an adult and play/learn from the interactive exhibits.  The planetarium was mind blowing.  To see how insignificant we all are compared to the massive size of everything else.  The shows were also not childish so they were enjoyable.  There was not enough time to see everything so we will be planning a trip back next after dark.  I highly recommend this place if you have kids but also if you are an adult, just after hours on the special event nights.

We went on a Saturday in the winter so it was quite busy. They have lockers to store coats which require quarters and is convenient. Variety of dining options for each type of diet.  The exhibits were great with a variety of activities for all ages. The Ocean space was my favorite and such a different take on ocean theme. Would definitely come back.

This place was fun and we look forward to coming back and exploring more of it! The second floor has an AMAZING play area for toddlers (mine is 15ms) and older. It's a great place for them to run off steam. My son especially loved the firetruck he could climb in and pretend to drive.

We had a school field trip here and we had a great time! The kidsspace was an excellent place to let the kids explore, learn and have fun in a more controlled environment. The gadgets section had many fun and educational stations and the progress area was a hit as well. I'm certainly considering a membership here for the family.

Absolutely fantastic for kids of any age. They're supposed to touch and climb and hold everything, so as a parent, it's incredible. The little kids area is well-conceived, with cubbies, stroller areas, family restroom, nursing area, tons of interactive exhibits, and even a little sitting area with tables, chairs, sink, and paper towels for snack time. 

I hear there are things for adults too.

name: Hayden Falls Park
address: 4326 Hayden Run Rd, Dublin, OH 43017, USA
reviews: Very nice little falls and creek .There us a small parking lot ,and a few stairs .Once you are down the steps there is a wonderful wooden deck /pathway that leads to the falls. Well worth it .You would never know you were right off a 4 lane road
Fair warning, this "park" is small.  A path to the waterfall and back.  Very little parking.  I thought it would be more.  The view was pretty, but there just wasn't much to it.

There honestly isn't much to see here outside of the waterfall, so if there hasn't been a lot of rain, don't waste your time. 
It was completely dry the first time I saw it and flowing at about 25% the second time. We only went the second time out of stubbornness after it had rained a bit. 
The stairs and bridge take about 3 minutes before you hit the waterfall and have no further to go, so don't expect this to be a long jaunt. Definitely don't go unless you happen to be in the area and need fresh air.
Absolutely beautiful! Such an awesome place that you would never know existed when driving by.
Nice trail and beautiful waterfall. Tucked off right in Ohio. @otimages on Instagram! 🖤📸

name: Highbanks Metro Park
address: 9466 Columbus Pike, Lewis Center, OH 43035, USA
reviews: Easy to navigate trail system.  Plenty of parking options, restrooms, playgrounds, picnic tables, and small grills.  We hiked a 6 mile loop in February.  Trails are nice and wide.  Most wore hiking shoes or boots because it was muddy.  The mud didn’t stop people.  There were people out and about on the sunny day, but not so many that you would feel overwhelmed.  Great park.

High Banks is is so beautiful, great hiking/walking/running. One of the best metro parks in Columbus. The trails are very well kept, the trees are gorgeous in the fall, and there are a number of lovely views. It is a great place to run, walk, or walk your dog. The park is also nice and large, so you can easily get in some mileage.

We've come here a couple of times now to go on a walk or hike while in Columbus. 

The parking lot can get crowded on nice days, but we've always managed to find a spot. 

It's pretty easy to meander through the different trails. There are quite a few interconnected ones, so it's fun to string them together. 

We most recently walked on the dog path which is nice, but I prefer the hiking trails in the middle of the park. 

This is a great place to come to get outside close to the city.
Such a great area to walk, and my dogs love it too. its peaceful and everyone seems so vaooy to be there. Wonderful park
Great! The path was clear and smooth for walking. Sights were beautiful and saw deer, squirrels, large woodpecker, and other birds.  Will visit again soon!

name: Columbus Park of Roses
address: 3901 N High St, Columbus, OH 43214, USA
reviews: Nice park.Very beautiful and pleasant. Huge park to walk around. Huge variety of roses can be found. Amazing feeling seeing all those colors. We went in summer which made perfect sense weather wise. We spent about a couple of hours good spot to spend a few hours walking around.

I came the wrong time of year out of medical necessity.  It was still calming and relaxing, and the dog and I got much needed recreation and fresh air.  The ducks on the fishing pond were charming, as were the kids on  the playground... But the only flowers in bloom were wild ones untended by man, only invigorated by God.

This place is an absolute Oasis... it’s very relaxing and serene.  A perfect place for a walk in the spring and fall especially. The flowers are absolutely breathtaking! Gorgeous to say the least... a grounding environments deed.
Very good park for Pokemon GO, and plenty of benches for disabled folx like me. The whole area is nice too (from what I saw). Five stars!
This would be a great park if it wasn't always so packed. But foot traffic helps keep the park funded I guess. Some additional parking spots would be nice tho.

name: Franklin Park Conservatory and Botanical Gardens
address: 1777 E Broad St, Columbus, OH 43203, USA
reviews: Coming here is a small get away into other countries. You'll feel like you have left Columbus and entered into the jungles or deserts from across our amazing oceans. I do feel it wouldn't hurt for them to look into expanding the size of buildings and exhibits. Add in more plants and a little more variety.  However, it's a great place for adults and kids. Family fun for everyone. Cannot forget winter months, when the outdoor gardens are hung with lights and festive fun. Come check out your local garden !

Absolutely amazing..It made my day :) September was definitely a perfect time to visit the conservatory. Gardens were at their best and we also saw a lot of glass work on t display. We even saw the glass work as a ceiling. There is huge butterfly room. Before you go to the butterfly rooms check the time when they release the new/baby butterflies to the room. The staff makes a display as they try to fly for the first time. The staff was very enthusiastic about what they were doing.

Absolutely amazing place ❤️ Worth every dollar spent!!! The plant life is gorgeous and you can tell it’s well taken care of. I was absolutely in awe the whole time. I highly recommended giving this place a visit!!!! Also, the food at the garden cafe was so delicious and fairly priced! The staff were also extremely nice.  A must see place!!! So happy I decided to make the drive and spend the day here 😊

I've been going to the conservatory since I was a child and I've always loved getting to see the Chihuly pieces intertwined with the flowers and trees. They've added a massive outdoor children's area that even in the winter seems very inspiring and adventure worthy! Not to mention their seasonal displays which are always beautiful and educational. As a history nerd, the current exhibit about Victorian green houses and flower arrangement was super cool in how it ties back to the conservatory's own history. Always a lovely experience!

The conservatory is a historic treasure.  Some parts of this area are 125 years old and make you feel part of a bygone era.  Amazing plant variety and displays.  Went to see the Chilluly exhibit at an after-hours event.  Very classy!  Music, drinks and upscale snacks made this a night to remember.   You should come and experience it for yourself.

name: Wagner-Hagans Auto Museum
address: 476 E Kossuth St, Columbus, OH 43206, USA
reviews: Great little bit of history tucked away in Columbus with a private collector who’s done his research and gives awesome little fun facts and trivia questions  during the whole  walk through. Thank you Steve for the amazing experience. 5/5 would recommend!

If you're looking for something to do in German Village and you love cars, this is the place to go. I recommend you to call, since it's by appointment. They have cars from the 40', '50 & 60'. Also plates from different states and other countries... I found one of Puerto Rico! The host guide you and talks about every car they have, and kindly answer questions if you have any particular doubt.
This is a great place to visit! Call and make an appointment before you go. It's really easy to do. Lots of artifacts from recent auto history...1940s onward.
Fascinating place for car lovers as well as car noobs. Steve Wagner is an amazing person!

To my knowledge, it is a private car museum owned by two life-long friends that have been collecting cars since their early 20's. As of late, these guys have accumulated between 40-60 cars, that are scattered around Columbus. This location holds roughly 20 cars, ranging from mostly old classics, to newer sports cars, with the vast majority being mint.

I've passed this place so many times in the past, and I had always wondered what's inside... especially after seeing the pictures online, and even snapping a few myself as they rotated cars! I noticed the door was open on Labor Day, and I decided to stop in.

I spoke briefly with Steve Wagner, and it's clear that they're just two car guys in love with what they do, and in love with these great classics. Their collection is open to all, but only by appointment. Tours are free of charge as far as I'm aware, and they prefer to hold them on the weekends. Contact information is still hard to find, but it is out there.

Overall, this is just one of the many gems lying around Columbus, waiting to be discovered! I highly recommend taking some time to stop by, and to hear the stories they have to share!!

name: Ohio History Connection
address: 800 E 17th Ave, Columbus, OH 43211, USA
reviews: Loved it here. My wife and I were married here. Excellent selection for a wedding. I love you and you are my world, my breath, my everything.

Wonderful insight to Ohio's past and what life was like in the late 1800s . Plenty of history and cultural galleries to wander through at your own pace.  The village is interesting also. It takes you back in time to a progressing era in our world. A great place for young or old to enjoy. The onsite cafe has plenty to choose from for eats. I would give yourself at least 4 to 5 hours to enjoy.

A great way to spend a couple hours learning about regional and state of Ohio history. I particularly enjoyed the walk-through experience of the Lustron manufactured home, as well as the exhibit about Ohio soldiers' participation in the Civil War. Great for all ages! (Visited in Oct. 2018)
A great way to spend a couple hours learning about regional and state of Ohio history.
Came years ago for school and missed it so I visited again and enjoyed it!

name: Scioto Audubon Metro Park
address: 400 W Whittier St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: Love the free rock climbing wall.  The dog park is good as well.  Paved trail is good for rollerblading or biking!

Trails seem to be well kept, and there is a rock climbing wall next to a playground. If you plan to climb, be sure to bring gear like harness and clip, as you could get in trouble for trying to free solo the wall without the gear. In addition to that, when it's not too muddy, theres an obstacle course just a couple steps away from the wall, and a water tower where you can take a good look overhead of the park.

We love this park! My husband boulders and my pup and I love to walk the trails and pathway into the city. It also has a large kid's park next to the rock climbing pad. We really enjoy coming down here!
Awesome park! Lots of walking paths and grassy areas. The obstacle course is really cool, and so is the rock climbing wall.
First time visiting and our dog loved it, very clean, very friendly owners and a great way fornour dog to play with other you will love it.

name: Ohio Statehouse
address: 1 Capitol Square, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: We visited from Cleveland, and it was a wonderful experience to see the Capitol of our own state. Even on a Monday morning it was a quick, painless drive from a nearby suburb where our hotel was. We parked in the garage under the building that was easy to find and very inexpensive (for 2 hours it was $4). We began the free tour in the Map Room that has all of the counties of Ohio in stone, which was a very beautiful tribute to each location. The tour guide was very friendly and knowledgeable about the history of the buildings, as well as current happenings in the government. It is a beautifully done Greek Revival style building that has many tributes to the history of Ohio. There is also a very interactive museum that houses modern displays of new government as well as the original Ohio declaration. Everyone was friendly, had a kind welcome and warm smile. We felt so welcome and will be happy to return- an overall great experience. It made us very proud to be Ohioans!

I'm so pleased that there's a cafe near our side with an interior layout of tables fully intended for their customers to linger over a coffee to work, chat, and socialize. This courtyard is delightful, with a shade tree and a dripping water fountain along a vegetated wall, that shuts out the ugly concrete grind just on the outside. The tables don't feel flimsy, and they are well sized for laptops or discussions among groups. Certain tables are closer to the outlets which are often thoughtfully pointed out, and most of the exterior tables are within proximity of one of their standing gas heat lamps, which is precisely necessary when seated for long periods. In all this is a cafe user's dream, which most other places don't seem to get right.

What an incredible experience. Beautiful architecture, wonderful history and well preserved and detailed grounds. We had a great time. Parking was easy and affordable and everyone was friendly. This is a great tribute to Ohioans and Americans alike.
Beautiful building! Definitely worth exploring. And the gift shop was lovely.
I attended the Ohio's Hill Country Heritage Area Recognition luncheon. It was a wonderful event.

name: Goodale Park
address: 120 W Goodale St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: The park is very clean, and taken care off. The people that come here with their dogs, are always taking care of their pets and making sure all the animals get along. Very pretty here and relaxing.

One of the things I love about my neighborhood is Goodale Park, situated in the middle of Victorian Village. On any given day--especially from spring to fall--the park is filled with neighbors, dogs, tourists, joggers, picnicers, and nature lovers. The park is the perfect place for a morning or evening stroll, the perfect spot to play tennis on one of the many tennis courts, the perfect place to hold or attend a neighborhood meeting, and the perfect spot to soak in the sun. Definitely worth the visit.
Best park in downtown! There are always a lot of people walking their puppies/using their hammocks here. There are also a lot of ducks around the fountain! Love coming here.
Great place to enjoy a walk in the city. Grab coffee at Short North or the north market before hand. Very dog friendly!
The area is great for crowds of all ages. Parking is challenging but you'll find a place. Most enjoyable in spring/summer.

name: ZipZone Outdoor Adventures
address: 7925 N High St, Columbus, OH 43235, USA
reviews: We had so much fun here! They train you and help you all along the way. We did the zipline in the trees and the scenery was amazing! Staff members were funny and very helpful. If you want a fun trip to do something different I highly recommend this!

The instructor was super friendly and thorough! Very fun and out of the box activity to do! I was there with a group of 22-27 year old adults but saw families and people of all ages there!

The only reason I gave them 4 stars is due to the location, you have to make a u turn to find it! And the path to the “parking lot” is super narrow

We love ZipZone! Our first time there was great. Staff is super friendly, & understanding for people like me who are afraid of heights. There is a variety of levels available for different skills from easy to extremely difficult. The forest is beautiful & shady. Can't wait to go back!
Had a wonderful and it was a beautiful day. Will definitely go back

It was very fun and the staff was great. They emphasized safety and they were very patient with people that were scared. I will probably be back to do the adult course because I took the kids. Despite that it was a fun place if you enjoy outdoor adventures and activities.

name: LEGOLAND Discovery Center Columbus
address: 157 Easton Town Center, Columbus, OH 43219, USA
reviews: Let's just get this out of the way... the entrance is in the mall! Other than the entrance being a little hard to find this place is awesome. My 8 and 5 year old had an absolute blast and they cannot wait to go back. The staff was very friendly, helpful and patient. We will definitely return!

Lots of fun for the kids. They space out your start times to make sure it does not get over crowded. Constantly updating so every visit they seems to be something new for us. (We do not go that often though)

It was an amazing day trip. Employee's we very nice and helpful. Kids had a blast. There is plenty to do and you can spends a few hours here. Kind of nice that it is in a mall. So if you want to go shopping after you can. Crowd was not bad for a saturday afternoon. Parking was easy. Great experience.

This place has 15 minute 4D (3D plus spays water, fog and has lighting) Lego movies in the movie theater.

Small 4 person ride with lazer lego guns to shoot at tagets and at characters on multiple screens. 

Has some nice huge displays

Places to build and race cars down two different tracks.

Has a couple other areas that have sandbox type areas full of Legos to just be creative and build. 

A lot more than I expected.

Oh also has a small circular ride (2 seater) that has petals and the faster you petal you hight you a lifting in the air.

We had a great day with our son. He is 10yrs old and had a great time.  Prices were fair for all you get to do, but having lunch there is a bit pricey.
Very clean and safe.

name: Central Ohio Fire Museum
address: 260 N 4th St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: Great place to visit with guided tour. If you have kids then they work great with them as well.  Highly recommend this for a visit!

I visited the Central Ohio Fire Museum recently [10-24-2019] during a leisurely afternoon stroll between Italian Village and Franklinton.

I had arrived at the Central Ohio Fire Museum about twenty minutes before they would be closing so the guy at the entrance let me in for free. Actually, I probably would have spent only about twenty minutes there anyway.

I had been able to see, during my brief visit, several things that I clearly remember from my childhood [for example, a former black-and-white embossed City-of-Columbus "street sign" design that is no longer used and a former yellow "telephone call box," to be mounted on a telephone pole, that is no longer used].

The Central Ohio Fire Museum building is historic because it had served for many years as a Columbus Fire Department fire house. The "No. 16 ENGINE HOUSE" words are clearly visible on the front wall of the building above the large doors.

The "OSU-Michigan football rivalry" had been clearly evident at the Central Ohio Fire Museum. The horse for a horse-drawn fire truck in the center of the room had been wearing both a "University of Michigan" cap [on the right side of its head] and a "The Ohio State University" cap [with only the word "THE" visible on the front] [on the left side of its head].
small town but interesting things to see from horse drawn fire trucks

Really cool place. Attended a birthday party here and it worked out really well. A lot of neat historical fire fighting equipment and the goddess were very knowledgeable and friendly. Would definitely recommend it.

A nice museum  in an old firehouse from the horse drawn era. The real asset is Sue who is very passionate  about fire safety  and the items and rooms with actual fire damage so people  can see the effects  of fire.  Well worth the low admission  price. What you learn may save your life.

name: Grange Insurance Audubon Center
address: 505 W Whittier St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: Nice area, first time seeing it after walking trail for at least 3 miles.

I really love going there. What used to be the cities impound lot, eyesore, was transformed into a beautiful park and mini nature preserve. Rock climbing wall, parcore course, nature and bike trails. Dogs are welcome, and there is a dog park for our furry family members. Be sure to take a walk through the Audubon center at the visitor center.
Nature is all the more precious when it's an oasis tucked in the midst of the hustle and bustle of the city.
I love the center and the surrounding park they have created over the years. Great place to visit with the family while on a hike!
Great place for birding during migrations.  Bring binoculars and/or a spotting scope and have a blast!  Some years they hold the national birding expo at this location.  Highly recommend.

name: Kelton House Museum & Garden
address: 586 E Town St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: Loved seeing the authentic furniture in the home and hearing the story of the family taking in the sick little girl slave who had traveled from VA.  The bsmt display where the slave would stay was great too!

This is an interesting historic site, if you are a history fan, especially the civil war, you will definitely love this place. The guide here is very helpful and friendly. Also the ticket is really cheap, if you have student Id, it's only 4$. And they offer an electronic self guide system. So you can know everything about the house while enjoying the view.

Such a rich history.  Had a very abnormal experience in the dining room.  I felt a sudden burst of tears and started bawling my eyes out during the tour. Not sure what happened but I felt fine as soon as I left the room. Beautiful gardens and wonderful staff.  If your nearby it's worth the stop.

We were able to go mid-morning on a weekday and were the only people touring the building. The house is stunning and the single employee was very knowledgeable/ helpful in getting us started on the self-guided audio tour. As it was the holidays, there were local antique Christmas decorations throughout the house. With many rooms to explore and comprehensive information on the audio guide tracks, it was informative and overall a fun experience. It was too cold to tour the gardens and had there been a larger group our solo employee may have been overwhelmed, but if looking for history in Columbus this is a can’t miss!
Lovely place to visit. Really liked the decor of the house. Went for the self-guided audio tour; it helped to have my wired earphones with me.

name: Scioto Mile Fountain
address: Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews:
Get cool..!!

This is a great place to get cool amid hot summer heat. Kids enjoy the splash. Enjoyp great walking along the downtown skyline view. Great view of downtown.

Street side paid parking available.
This is a lovely park. It feels very safe, and I would definitely recommend it.

This fountain is located in downtown Columbus and is a wonderful place to bring kids on a summer day. There are actually three types of fountain here where kids, and adults, can play around and cool off. The long stretch with jets of water shooting up from the ground is the most popular and there are children of all ages splashes around. There was someone on duty while we were there reminding kids to walk and not run. There are some tables, stone "benches" and plenty of grassy area to sit and relax while keeping an eye on your kiddos. We parked in the lot right across the street for a $10 daily fee
Beautiful location. Fun fun all ages.
Awsome fountains for the kids to play in. Not all of them were working.

name: Inniswood Metro Gardens
address: 940 S Hempstead Rd, Westerville, OH 43081, USA
reviews: Wonderful little spot. Great variety of flowers. Pretty paths and lots of great places to sit on a bench and chill.
Inniswood Metro Gardens was a lovely park to visit. The walkways were well maintained and the variety of plants and trees was impressive. I will certainly be back.

A nice little getaway from the fast-paced city life. There's no admission and you walk right in. A good place to take the kids. No pets allowed though. Peaceful trails, beautiful flowers and wildlife. There's always couples walking, people playing Pokemon go, birdwatchers, or groups taking wedding photos or prom photos. Even with the variety of people, it's never too crowded.

Of all the Metro Parks near Columbus this one has something for everyone.  Lots of paths where you can stroll past wildlife and trees, but it also has wonderful themed gardens, many of which are aimed at kids. Throughout the park it has art along the paths, from giant statues to small mosaics and everything in between. My favorite that they had in the past was a giant steel praying mantis. My daughter loves the "hidden" walled garden and my son loves the bridge over a stream where he can sit and watch for fish. If you want to take the family for a walk and enjoy a little bit of a lot of things, Inniswood is a great place to go. Also has bathroom facilities, picnic tables and a historic home on site. The park also prides itself on its flowers, they are planted everywhere and they are beautiful. Admission is free so take the family out for an afternoon and enjoy some clean air and stretching your legs!

I really enjoy coming here, it's free! Walking around here is pretty wonderful and it's nice to have a place to go when I just want to get out of the house for alone time. I saw an owl today, at 5 pm, it was still light out! There are many different paths to walk through and most of them are labeled with the distance. There are also lots of benches scattered around and the place is well managed. The restroom condition is unknown to me, which is surprising. Thanks for reading, I highly recommend visiting, and I hope this helps.

name: Pizzuti Collection of Columbus Museum of Art
address: 632 North Park St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews:
The Pizzuti Collection is always worth a stop. Now part of The Columbus Museum of Art, you don't need a separate membership to go. If you're from out of state and belong to a museum that's part of the North American Reciprocal, you can use that membership card at the Pizzuti, too.

The Pizzuti focusses on contemporary art and installations. It's on three floors and can be seen in less than an hour if you don't stop to read all of the interpretations. If you take a more contemplative tour, you can spend two to three hours seeing everything. 

There are some metered parking spaces in front of the museum and ample parking in the various garages in the Short North.
Fantastic exhibits time and time again.  If you haven't seen "Chairs" yet, do yourself a favor and check it out your list.

Enjoyed the collection and the staff were very helpful.
The rooms and lighting  make viewing the works very enjoyable.
Amazing place and free on Sundays
It was so cool with lots of  different art. And the art is always changing. I went on the free day, and I really recommend it.

name: Thurber House
address: 77 Jefferson Ave, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: An interesting museum in the house that James Thurber lived in and wrote about.  Thurber was born and raised in Columbus, Ohio.  He became a writer and cartoonist.  He spent much of his career writing and drawing for the "New Yorker" magazine.  The house is furnished much as it was in 1917.

Took a trip to Columbus for some Paranormal fun and did a surprise visit to The Thurber House — the tour guide was amazing! We enjoyed our visit and for some awesome EVPs! Mame does not like her portrait!
Great day! My niece became a Docent yesterday.
Amazing place, so beautiful.
Really cool piece of history.

name: Wyandotte Winery
address: 4640 Wyandotte Dr, Columbus, OH 43230, USA
reviews: We had an amazing time! The owner was so nice and answered all of our questions. The wine was some of the best wine I have ever had. We read reviews before going and had high expectations that were far exceeded. The back patio was so comfortable and the food was amazing. Anyone trying to find a nice low key place for a date or day trip with friends should definitely go to Wyandotte. We will be going back every chance we get!

First time at Wyandotte and it was an awesome place. Great atmosphere and great service. Wine was good and the appetizers were very good as well. Wednesday is happy hour night so there are some great deals. We will definitely be back.

My wife and I visited Wyandotte yesterday for the first time as a part of their Unwind and Rewind with Thrive. After a fantastic experience at Thrive, we were really let down by Wyandotte. After telling the man working that we were there for the promotion, he set us up with our wine and hummus plate, and then never came back to check on us, which was disappointing because we wanted to hang out for a few hours, and order lunch and a bottle or two of wine. 

I am not entirely sure how they split up sections, but there were two other employees who checked on the 3-4 surrounding tables while we had empty wine glasses 4 different times. I had to flag down our original server to ask for a tasting of two other wines, but he never came back to ask if we needed anything else. My wife was upset and felt like we were being ignored because we were there as a part of a promotion, so she asked to go somewhere else for lunch. It definitely was not how I wanted my wife to feel on our date, and made me feel cheap. There was a man in a black shirt that noticed our empty plate and 4 empty wine glasses (two from the promo and two from the tasting) after a few rounds of checking on other tables, but at that point, we were just ready to go. 

Compared to other reviews, it seems like this experience is the exception, but we probably won’t be back to find out, which is disappointing because the wine was fantastic. Our time here left my wife feeling insecure about herself since we didn’t receive much service compared to the other tables, which is the opposite of how I would ever want her to feel on a special date.
Great place to meet friends drink some good wine,very laid back,fun..great staff

Really enjoy the atmosphere!
Customer service has always been EXCELLENT
Wines are VERY TASTY!  They have quite a few choices.  Check Wyandotte Out!👍👍

name: Scioto Greenway
address: 400 W Whittier St, Lockbourne, OH 43137, USA
reviews: Not crowded and has a good view...what can you ask more? Close to Columbus Science Museum and sometimes there is fairs at the park.
Lots of open space. Kids loved the military style course. Great for most ages and abilities.
Girlfriend took me and I was amazed . Great job down there
It's worlds different than when I used to come down here as a kid for red, white, and boom. Letting the river flow naturally makes all the difference!
Beautiful from the river to obstacle course and a great place for family & pets

name: Orton Geological Museum
address: 155 Oval Dr S, Columbus, OH 43210, USA
reviews: This is a great place to stop in if you are in the area.  I took my 12 year old who is really into rocks, minerals and fossils and he loved it.  They have a great library across the hall as well.

Great little museum to spend around an hour in when on campus. There are around 5-6 dinosaur fossils and several small fossils and minerals across many geological eons to explore. A geological library is also present next to it. A small store too.

Great place to see fossils and minerals. My 8 yr old enjoyed it. It is a part of an OSU education building.  It's a small museum but it has a lot of cool stuff. The building it's in kinda looks like a castle which was also cool.
Great little museum of geology. There are some great fossils and displays on various geological formations. Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area.
Good local museum where you can meet Zeke the dinosaur.  Free admission and it takes about half an hour to see everything.  Best place in central Ohio to take children to see dinosaur bones.

name: McFerson Commons Park
address: 218 West St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: I've been in Columbus since 1961 i am 58 yrs old the photo me was last year. Columbus has changed from a one cent pony town. To a vibrant mecca of specialized shops. Music so good from neck of the woods its impossible to keep up. We have are ups and downs homelessness has grown but its being dealt with frantically and carefully. The homeless are vibrant and weary but they are survivors. Some industry have changed Columbus. Downtown is a wonderful to be McPherson Commons Park is a fine example Mayor Coleman left as he finally retired from the mayorship after 12 beautiful long years. When you see the high rises all over Columbus you'll see Mayor Coleman. I met him last year panhandling for a sick friend. I also gave him money. I was amazed how he shook my hand and gave me money😲🥵😂i was truly happy to meet the man who gave Columbus a superior shot arm. Enjoy us,live with us. You'll love what you'll see 😉
Great place to host an outdoor event.  Convenient parking and near the river with great views of the city. We were there for Leukemia and Lymphoma Light the Night event
Arch from former downtown train station moved to this park. Nice size park well shaded and plenty of benches. Easy to walk around park. Park is across from Blue Jackets hockey arena.
Very peaceful place to hang out. Was very quiet on a Wednesday evening.
Arena District Athletic Club brings us here weekly in the spring and summer months. Love it!

name: Indian Run Falls
address: 700 Shawan Falls Dr, Dublin, OH 43017, USA
reviews: A nice little park with a nice stream running through it. The waterfall is pretty relaxing plus its within walking distance to tacos so win win.

Indian Run Falls is a neat little nature trail located in Dublin, Ohio. Has small yet beautiful falls and a nature trail the goes back about 8 tenths of a mile. When you pull in to the small parking lot there is a small log cabin and another one right behind it. Very scenic and peaceful to see and here the water ripple over the falls. If you are ever around the Columbus, Ohio area, make sure to stop by and pay this place a visit.  There are several other falls that are in the area as well. It's all free and well worth the stop to to get off the beaten path for a while and enjoy the scenery.
I love coming here. You can tell a lot of effort was put into making this a place that people can enjoy. I especially like the observation decks.
great place to have a moment of peace and enjoy nature! I enjoy dipping my feet in water every time I visit.
Beautiful place, you would never expect this place by its surroundings. Definitely worth a visit.

name: Glass Axis
address: 610 W Town St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: Just took glass ornament class tonight. It was incredibly fun & informative. Lisa was an excellent instructor and super encouraging to us first timers. Color choices were wonderful, the facility was great & the prices in their gift shop were super affordable. I'm getting my unique glass ornaments here from now on. I can't wait to take another class.
Excellent!! Took the pumpkin class great instructors great fun!
Went twice instructor was amazing with us. We made witches balls and tumblers. Amazing date idea!
The glass blowing class was a lot of fun.  They have a shop full of beautiful glass decorations for sale.
Instructor was helpful and skilled.  Classes allow for easy introduction to the complicated processes.

name: North Bank Park
address: 311 W Long St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: A beautiful park with a spectacular view of downtown Columbus and the Scioto River. If the parking meters on Spring Street are bagged for no parking you can park in the Neil Avenue Garage in the Arena District. It's a very short walk after that.

GORGEOUS. Would love to have my wedding here someday. The view is gorgeous; the space is cozy, yet big enough for a decent sized party (ceremony and reception). I would mainly just worry about parking, but there are a couple of parking garages just up the street (walking distance).
Great place to walk or sit and think. I remember when it was being built.
Married the love of my life and it was beautiful venues...gorgeous sunset, view...
An absolutely amazing place to spend a few moments having lunch or hosting your event. Please, treat yourselves.

name: Magic Mountain Fun Center - Polaris
address: 8350 Lyra Dr, Columbus, OH 43240, USA
reviews: I loved this place so much as a child. So many good memories here. I spent hours climbing up and down the massive play area and playing the arcade games.

Overall, if you want a cheaper place to let your kids run around and play games for a bit it's a good place to go. However they opened their mini golf but no waterfalls working which may be normal since it just started getting warm and all the greens had holes and ripples through it making it really hard to play. We ordered pizza and fries and the food was terrible! I'm not expecting gourmet at all but the pizza wasn't even cooked all the way and tasted like cardboard and they burnt our fries to where they were dark brown. They didnt have any normal size straws and all condiments were out and the snack sitting area was filthy!
Was here for a neighbor's birthday party. Liked the place. Children's gym kept the kids busy. Laser tag was exciting as well.

This is a fun place in my opinion. It’s cheap you pay 5$ I don’t remember how many tokens you get but it’s a great deal. Games here are great to. There’s nothing that I don’t like about this place. But if you’re willing to splurge you should go to Scene 75 it’s really fun there to I wrote a review of that to 😁.

We booked a party, under the impression the kids would be able to play (weird right?) When we got there my 4 year old was kicked or of the play area for not having a wristband. Ok, no problem, they come with the package. We asked the attendant who said our server would have them in ten minutes. After waiting about 30 we were told the children couldn't play until after the party was over. Which of course we were never told. We were told it was a sure managers decision. What kind of a company not only neglects to tell their customers vital information about their contracts?! Also, the food was absolutely disgusting and EVERYTHING was sticky. If we had known what we were getting into we never would have paid for they're "service" they absolutely ruined his birthday

name: Antrim Park
address: 5800 Olentangy River Rd, Columbus, OH 43085, USA
reviews:
Our daughter loves the playground. It's small, but so is she.

My wife and I run here regularly. The oval path around the lake is great.

Could use better restroom facilities, and you have to be careful of bicycles, especially as you first go under the bridge to the trails. It would be nice to have permanent restrooms, not port-o-johns, and some sort of bypass for the main entrance so people don't cross the traffic coming in either direction-speeding bicycles and runners with headphones going in perpendicular directions causes accidents.

My favorite park of all times. This park has perfect sunsets. Beautiful views...It has a great path circling the beautiful Antrim Lake. If you just want to watch the view, that is fine as well, there are various places to sit and they are mostly available. You can walk your pet with a leash on. There is plenty of parking; no need to worry about. I advise you to bring a water bottle with you because there is no water fountain and no place to buy refreshments. This park is a heaven! I missed this park so much because I moved away.

A very nice trail around the lake. A good path down to a dam in the Olentangy River. Wonderful rocks on the river shore: flint, slate, fresh water oysters, and more. Lots of fungi, too. There's a bike trail as well.
What a beautiful place to walk... the walk around the lake is approx 1.3 miles..a serene, quiet place to either walk or run. It is a little secluded, so I do not walk @ night for obvious reasons.

This is a lovely park. They have soccer fields, a basketball court, and three trail choices. The first is a short path great for little ones, small dogs or less active people. There's medium trail that is great for a jog. Finally, there's the ten mile bike path that gives you a great ride down to Columbus. The park is well-maintained and feels very safe during the day. There's a small lake for fishing too!

name: Sharon Woods
address: 6911 Cleveland Ave, Westerville, OH 43081, USA
reviews: So many paths. The lake and the view were great. Playground for kids was great. Lots of programs go on even during the winter months. Can't wait to see it in the spring and summer 😊. Just moved here. I'm excited to go back..

I took my granddaughters to the annual winter hike. It was overflowing with hikers, but the park rangers kept things moving. The hot chocolate and soup at the end were wonderful. My only complaint was that the shorter 2 mile route was not stroller friendly. I couldnt have made it up the gravel paths without the help of some very friendly fellow hikers.
Very nice area in Hocking Hills. Beautiful cabins everywhere. The one we are staying at is very secluded and in the middle of a deep valley. It's very serene and peaceful here

We attended a wedding reception here. The space was warm and clean and inviting. It was a perfect place for the party. Parking was easy, even for my parents who need to be close to a door. We were very happy to have had a chance to see the park and lodge.
A lovely little metro park tucked away between Columbus and Westerville. It has a few good walking trails, it's pet friendly, and there is beautiful small lake in the back where you can fish.

name: Columbus Zoo and Aquarium
address: 4850 W Powell Rd, Powell, OH 43065, USA
reviews:
Best zoo in Ohio. They have a wide variety of different exhibits grouped together based on climate regions. By far my favorite place to visit in Columbus. The highlights include the amazing polar bear exhibit, African safari, aquarium, tiger exhibit, and chimpanzee exhibit. 

They have something for every age here. There are plenty of concession stands and restaurants throughout the park. Highly recommend going to the nocturnal exhibit on hot summer days to escape the heat. 

The zoo lights around Christmas are a must see. The entire park is lit up with colorful lights. The pond at the entrance of the park is decorated for a light show that plays about every 20 minutes and will keep everyone entertained. Not all of the animals will be out on display during this time, the ones that are include the bears, Mexican wolves, Arctic foxes, and most of the indoor exhibits like the aquarium and the nocturnal exhibit.

If you’re visiting Columbus or live in Ohio, you should definitely stop by!!!

My experience at this location was absolutely magical. I was blessed and able to take in the beauty of the Wild Lights. I took pictures and videos of this and it was just gorgeous. I will make sure to visit this spot every winter to take in the all that is the Wild Lights of Columbus Zoo and Aquarium. There were a lot of smiles on every face of every child. It's a place where you see love Blossom both young and old as elderly and young people Jeremy experiences a hold hands and see the beauty of this place. Going at night who made the difference.

We love this zoo.  Since my kids were born we've tried to make sure the hit a few big city zoos every summer.  Columbus is our favorite.  It's big, but not so big that you have to rush to get through it.  Every major animal is here.  In the back by the lions there's a restaurant with an awesome views of the African plains animals, definitely worth have lunch there.

I love this place. Amazing animal habitats, awesome staff, and honestly the food courts aren’t bad. I will say that the carousel never works (I’ve been there twice in two years and both times it was closed). Overall I do like it!

A beautiful zoo. The animal habitats look like what the animals would live in if they were in their natural habitats. In order to really enjoy the zoo, you need to allow for a full day for your visit. There are several restaurants to purchase food from or you can pack your own.

name: Blacklick Woods Metro Park
address: 6975 E Livingston Ave, Reynoldsburg, OH 43068, USA
reviews: This is the best park in our area. We live about three blocks away and spend the majority of our summer here. There are three playgrounds here, each with different equipment, for different ages. The shelters are clean and open, surrounded with grassy area for games. We used a shelter for our daughters first birthday party and had a blast. The shelter was easy to decorate and large enough for our fifty guests. The kids ran around in the grass and played at the playground. We walk the trails with our kids and visit the nature center. This park is fantastic for families.

We really enjoy this park. We bring our daughter here all throughout the summer because it has nice walking trails and a couple playgrounds. She never gets bored and if you play Pokemon Go, the place is littered with pokestops and gyms with raid battles. This park is a hot spot during community day.
Love this park. Both small trail and long trail. If you go in morning, you will usually see deer. Mamma with babies, just laid there and looked at me. Beautiful park

This park reminds of the late 60s and early 70s. The walkways and the nature center are kind of a homey feeling , but the noise from 24, 7 traffic,  ugh.  A nice getaway for awhile in the woods. And seems pretty safe.
The nature center was fun for my toddlers. They had a lot of fun watchinf the fish, bird view and the toys and puppets. Great spot for kids!

name: Pickerington Ponds Metro Park
address: 7680 Wright Rd, Canal Winchester, OH 43110, USA
reviews: Good for a quick walk, but nothing much to look at. Decent pond view. I will go back in the summer to see how it looks without being all brown
Nice place to birdwatch, no dogs allowed. Glacier Knoll, a bit further north is good for walkie.
Great walking and biking trails!  Plus it's a fantastic spot to bring your dogs!
Absolutely beautiful! Very hidden and secluded! Highly recommended!
Wonderful views, great paths. Well maintained and clean

name: The Ohio Railway Museum
address: 990 Proprietors Rd, Worthington, OH 43085, USA
reviews:
A small but very informative train museum. It appears to be ran completely by volunteers so that’s why the museum has limited hours. 

Yes the some of the trains appeared to be in disrepair but it’s because they rely heavily on donations/volunteer work to restore them.

We attended during one of their Saturday holiday events and enjoyed it. My daughter and I really enjoyed the trains. We especially enjoyed the 30 minute ride down the line and back in a old train car. 

Highly recommend this place for the train enthusiast in your life or for kids. Be sure to check their website for hours and special events.

This was such a great afternoon with the kids. The museum didn't need anything too fancy because they just had really great trains.  We had a great little ride on the inter-urban, but I had hoped it would be a little longer than it was.
It was lovely, learned alot about the trains and da kids also got a train ride
Trolley rides and great train cars to walk through
Small place but jam packed with neat stuff. The trolley ride is short but well worth it. We were lucky enough to catch a passing NS freight and they stopped so we could watch it.

name: SegAway Tours of Columbus
address: 400 N High St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: A must see and do experience. We’ve went twice now and have told so many about it. You gather a wealth of knowledge about Columbus that you probably didn’t know previously. Usually a small group and very personable staff. I highly recommend this.
Definitely the best way to learn your way around the city and see it's sights. You get to visit many parks and great views of the Columbus area. Definitely worth the time.
Very fun and informative! Great way to get out and learn more about Columbus! The tour was lead safely and thoughtfully with room for fun and speed. Great for all levels of ability.

This was such a great adventure. I had never used a Segway before and the tour guide, David, had great instructions and made sure we all were educated well enough to travel before heading out. The Segway was so much fun to drive and I want one. The tour was fun and it was nice when we stopped a few times, David took our photo for us.
Such a fun way to learn more about the City of a Columbus. Our tour guide was great and the segways were surprisingly easy to learn. We look forward to doing the Christmas tour!!

name: Buckeye Escape Room
address: 1495 Morse Rd, Columbus, OH 43229, USA
reviews: Vest fun ever with matt

What fun we had! This was our first try with an escape room and thankfully there were more experienced people with us lol
We did help with a few things and assisted in figuring out some of the puzzles. It's too bad we live so far away - I'd love to try the crazy kittie room. 😹
Thank you to fun actor "Antonio" for a great performance and being our subtle clue giver.  Also kudos for allowing complete novices (us) who just walked in off the street (again us) asking if we could join in. It was great not needing a reservation. 

The only thing they could improve on is having a website with information about how to sign up for an adventure.
Think like a vietnamese man you will win

We had a mixed group - 3  adults, 3 teens - and everyone had a great time.  Jasmin was awesome at giving us a few subtle hints and at making sure we were all involved and enjoying ourselves.  We escaped the 90's with minutes to spare and would definitely try another room.

Very fun, though the guide was a bit too generous with the clues. Definitely hope to visit again and just let them know that we'd prefer to do things on our own and only get help when we're truly stuck on something.

name: Blendon Woods Metro Park
address: 4265 E Dublin Granville Rd, Columbus, OH, USA
reviews: Great children's programs! Very impressed with their rangers, and my kids always have a great time. We also really enjoy the natural play area and expiring the park!

Great park with beautiful hiking trails.  It is a birding hotspot in spring as it attracts a wide variety of warblers and other songbirds.  It is also famous for it's numerous wild turkeys.  I don't consider my visit "official" unless I see a Blendon Woods wild turkey.  Their nature programs are very good. The naturalist, Bruce, is an excellent and enthusiastic birding expert.
Great park, but the sugarbush trail was muddy as heck. Pretty much impassable. Be nice if they could throw down more gravel on the trail. I'd go back and try again.

Blendon Woods is so much fun for a family with kids. The nature center was fun and informative. The trail to the viewing area was also lots of fun and the signs are full of good information. The best part is the viewing area, on our last visit we saw eight turkeys and a deer. Overall, Blendon Woods was a great experience!
Very nice local park to walk around. It's nice to bring your kids or dogs as well but also not too crowded.

name: Frank Fetch Park
address: 228 E Beck St, Columbus, OH 43206, USA
reviews: Beautiful, beautiful park. Very refreshing with the plant life and little touches. This is a very small and delightful park. One nice touch is they have water bowls and a fountain hose for pets. We sent nearly an hour looking at everything and taking pictures. Early morning is best for street parking . Slow bumpy driving due to cobblestone streets.

Cute little pocket park in the midst of quite residential block in German village. Cool little spot for some chill time after dinner near by. Water fountain seem to run late into the night was beyond welcomed on such a hot/humid day! Sweet! 😊
Nice quiet restful park! Well designed!
Cute little park, nice spot to come during a lunch break. Had a water fountain and hose for dogs. Very relaxing .

Wonderful little park in the heart of German Village. Well-maintained landscaping that makes it obvious this little patch of land is loved and cared for. An underrated stop on dog walks through the neighborhood.

name: Zoombezi Bay
address: 10101 Riverside Dr, Powell, OH 43065, USA
reviews: The website says 26 slides and I believe them. There is a good mix of slides with some going into a  10 foot drop. The wave pool is great for family's and they have a kid pool and baboon lagoon which was more fun than I expected. I bought a season pass for $495 which was $105 a piece and $70 for kids under 10. You can also bring snacks, drinks, and sandwiches. To be honest I don't know why you would buy a pool in Columbus with the water park here.

Great fun! Lazy river, wave pool, kids water park area, an adults only area, and large water slides! Food is good, and they have cabanas you can rent for the day. When you get admission to the water park you can also go visit the animals in the zoo!
Best water park in USA for kids IMO. Love it. I went in evening and it's best because water is warm and less people. Fantastic and not too big of a place. Rides, slides and things are well designed.

Zoombezi Bay is so much fun for the whole family from toddlers to adults! Its always safe. There are lockers $10 to rent. Decent food. Or pack a few small snacks in a soft sided cooler. Be sure to get there early especially on the weekends,its hard to find a place to sit.

This water park was great! I was surprised by how large it was, being that it was in the zoo, but it has separate quarters. The kids had a ball. It was raining and a bit chilly, but it was a great experience and the kids had a great time and memories! So thank you!

name: Homestead Metro Park
address: 4675 Cosgray Rd, Hilliard, OH 43026, USA
reviews: A great park.  Good walking paths, exercise equipment, playgrounds, pavilions, small lakes, and a beautiful covered bridge. The park is huge and you can definitely spend a lot of time there. It also has a ton of Poke-stops and gyms for people who play Pokemon Go

It's a nice park. It's changed since the metro park system took over. Some of the fun things that kids liked have been removed like the squirt gun fort and the toddler water play area. Those were great in the summer. The main play ground is fun and the walking path is nice.

First visit.   Fall 2019 (basically early winter, right Ohio?)

Pretty large park.  Has plenty to see and do for everyone.

They have two playground areas, pne large in the center.. And a smaller train station themed one next to a replica train depot.

A covered wooden bridge crosses a large pond, a nature center with covered shelter, a large enclosed rental shelter and so much more...

Good running trail and lots of Pokemon go stops! A compact park with everything you'll need: playground, gazebo, basketball, volleyball

Also, a popular place for people getting pictures taken and weddings
Very cool place to visit.  We have some of the best metro parks we have visited.  There is a lot to see in Ohio.

name: Billy Ireland Cartoon Library & Museum
address: 1813 N High St, Columbus, OH 43210, USA
reviews: Very good museum, rich with good content.

LOVED the Cartoon Couture exhibit. The Exhibit was laid out in an organized manner & highly detailed. Such great content. 

The front desk staff were friendly & welcoming. I highly recommend any exhibit at the Billy Ireland Cartoon Library & Musuem. Such a great time!!

Decent collection of comic/cartoon artifacts. It's hard to complain about a free attraction, but I was expecting a little more with the word museum in the title (three rooms of items). Good to combine with the nearby Orton Geological Museum, which is also free and smallish.
Nice dive in American cartoon history . Was Some education for my kid too.
Wonderful, go check it out!

name: Battelle Riverfront Park
address: 25 Marconi Blvd, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: Great place to sit and just enjoy the sunset. Very Calm. People mostly come in groups with families and friends. Great place for cycling and skating as I saw many people doing that. A perfect picnic spot with great restaurants nearby.
It's a beautiful place, right in the middle of Downtown Columbus Ohio! Beautiful parks, seating areas, fountains, huge shade trees, a blast every time we go!
A great park to visit during your visit to downtown. Lovely river views. The statues have a story behind that you can read about on a plaque!

Nice park to visit and relax, we took a 10 min. walk by the river and it is truly one of the more peaceful spots in Columbus. There are alot of plaques and iron made statues, you can also walk close to one of the train bridges and rent bikes for cheap.

I took my nephews (3 & 26) for lunch on the swings then a walk along the river. The 3 yr old loved looking at the water and all the people watching. The 26 yr old liked the slower pace but being so close to downtown. We loved looking at the sculptures. It was the 1st wk of scooters being back in use so traffic on walk was pretty fast paced.

name: Motorcycle Hall of Fame Museum
address: 13515 Yarmouth Dr, Pickerington, OH 43147, USA
reviews: This was a very cool place, especially for someone like me, that is a novice motorcycle person at best. Their "bike nights" that are twice a year are quite entertaining and interactive. The museum is very cool, and my 10 year-old was mesmerized. A nine gift shop as well, and friendly and helpful staff. They genuinely want to be there. If you're in driving distance, it's a must do. You can also feel good about supporting a non-profit.
Fantastic place! Such amazing pieces on display! We are already planning a trip with family

Went with the whole family and everyone of us enjoyed it! There were some historical pieces as well as videos and artwork! There is a lot to look at and really cool facts to learn at each exhibit. I would highly recommend and can’t wait to go back!
Interesting and visually appealing even to me and I have no interest in motorcycles. Helpful and friendly staff.

Saw my first Observed Trials. Pretty cool...! A great family sport as the little tykes participated using small electric bikes and striders. The advanced and pros were interesting; some took the harder challenges with not much effort. Others were dabbing left and right. Literally! Go see one...

name: Motts Military Museum, Inc.
address: 5075 S Hamilton Rd, Groveport, OH 43125, USA
reviews: This is one of the best collectons of military equipment in the area. In fact, I would say that this is one of my top 3 musumes, and I've been to quite a few. If you like military history, weapons, or things that go BOOM, this is the place for you! The staff are knowledgeable and friendly, and the museum is very is well organized. The gift shop has lots of cool things too! My favorite item in the museum would have to be the fire truck from 9/11. I highly recommend this place!
Very interesting! I could have spent much longer than we did there. I can't wait to see progress on the 9-11 museum.

Mr. Motts' collection of weapons and military items is one of the coolest places I've ever been. Seeing all the little (and not so little) pieces of history there and their stories of where they came from is interesting. Very cool place with a lot of history
What a fabulous collection! The museum director and guides are fonts of information, friendly and engaging. We stayed for 2 1/2 hours and could have stayed twice as long if we'd had time.

One of the best military museums I have ever been to. Staff is friendly, tons of artifacts from all US involved conflicts, Civil War stuff is amazing. The Vietnam War Dog Memorial is top notch and was honor to meet the handler!  K-9 leads the way!

name: Arnold Statue
address: 486 N High St #474, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: A great inspiration to athletes competing at the convention center
It is outside Columbus convention center. Well maintained. Not much crowd would be there . So you can take pics without any trouble .
Not sure if this was meant to be life-size. Weird detailing, on the veins, but overall it was kinda cool. I was hoping for a statue of Christopher Columbus though
I'm a HUGE fan so this was pure awesomeness for me. Drove downtown just to see his statue and So Worth It.
Alyssa's cheer comp and loving it girls are doing great

name: Gardens at Gantz Farm
address: 2255 Home Rd, Grove City, OH 43123, USA
reviews: Nice family place with huge playground, cosy spots for fishing with your kids.
Amazing aromatherapy with their herb garden. My go to place to take a quick stroll and smell along the way. Really beautiful in the spring time when everything decides to bloom!

Fond childhood memories of the Barn! The new playground is excellent, a great update to a great park. Creek, walking paths, a cute gazebo and plenty of picnic opportunities. Beware on any HOCO or Prom night though, it's a hotspot for pictures.
Play ground updated. Lots of fun.
We love Gantz Park! It’s gorgeous year round. Can’t wait to see what the new playground is like!

name: Hoover Reservoir Park
address: 7701 Sunbury Rd, Westerville, OH 43081, USA
reviews: Nice to walk around and across the Hoover Dam. Great place to take pictures and enjoy the nature that is all around the dam. Was very peaceful the day we were there. I would guess it is a favorite place for the locals to walk and walk dogs. Was extremely clean and nice. Very nice parking lot.

I've been going to Hoover Reservoir Park since I was a child, never had a bad time here. The disc golf course is pretty good and there's ample space for traditional park activities like cooking out and such. Lots of area to walk around and enjoy nature. You can walk across the reservoir, fish and sail. Just a really good park to visit!
Very nice scenic area. A small amount of parking nearby. Not the most obvious turning off the road so keep your eyes sharp when heading towards it!
Beautiful place. Close to easy access. Nice cardio going up and down the stairs
Nice little park to go for a walk or bike ride. If you're from out of town the dam is definitely worth seeing.

name: Alum Creek State Park Beach
address: 3400 Lewis Center Rd, Lewis Center, OH 43035, USA
reviews:
This place should be called Kitty Litter Beach. 

The sand could be better, but it's not bad for Central Ohio!

A good place to go for a little swim. Best bet is to go when the water is cooler so you don't get the flesh eating bacteria from the lake.

Wonderful sand beach.  If you go during the day, Monday through Thursday there are very few people then.  Feels like you have the whole place almost to your self.  2 play grounds.  The water gets deeper very slowly so a great place for young children.  No life guards though.  Public restrooms.  Lots of free parking.  Free admission.

Clean beach and Nice playground area. It's free admission. Water is crystal clear. Less crowded. For kids play ground area good. No lifeguard on duty. You can say purely a picnic spot with family. You can do kite flying, swimming, boating , kayaking and enjoy the outdoor activities. Dip your feet in the water and enjoy. There is plenty of parking and  two (at least) restroom facilities. Signs for beach rules were easily seen. Parking is very near to the beach and not to walk much. Perfect place to spend 2-3 hours
Spent some time there and I played with sand. Enjoyed a lot 😊

beautiful park with a nice lake and walking trails.  The beach is rocky but clean. We didn't stay long, just checking  the place out for the triathlon race tomorrow. There were families enjoying the nice weather. I imagine during the summer season the concession area would be open. There were  locker rooms and showers available.

name: Columbus Museum Of Art KidsSpace
address: Inside the museum of art, Columbus, OH 43215, USA

name: Whetstone Community Recreation
address: 3923 N High St, Columbus, OH 43214, USA
reviews: My kids love the high slides but WHY is the tire swing so darn high? My 8 yr old can't get on it without my help and they are too heavy to lift that high.  It doesn't work properly being that high because it can't get enough swing going. We love that there are 2 play sets, one by the library and the other down by the open fields just past the rose garden.

This is such a great resource for families. Many kid classes such as gymnastics, pottery and even a soccer league and basketball teams. Adults can even take exercises classes, or workout in the gym. The library is right next door and the perfect size for kids and adults.

Nice gem of a park in the middle of an urbanesque community. Large swaths of fields, scattering of  ponds, plenty of geese, birds, and other wildlife. There are a few nice playgrounds, some nice shelters with fire pits, and even one with a giant mantled fireplace. Throughout the year there are an assortment of community events held here including fireworks movie nights and *plenty* of youth sports games. There are portapotties but no permanent latrines or plumbed bathroom facilities in the park itself but there's a community center nearby as well as a library. This is one of the most comprehensive, well-maintained, and enjoyable parks and recreation areas in central Columbus. Kudos to those responsible for establishing this park and those who continue to care for it.
Used to go all the time!!! This is a good place to hang out and do things you love.
Wonderful community resource. They have a wide variety of activities for all age groups and a wonderful staff supporting everyone

name: Main Street Bridge
address: 303 W Main St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: Main Street bridge sports some amazing views of downtown Columbus. This bridge has a unique arch and side walking path to add to it's functionality and aesthetic. This is not the most travelled bridge for me(like it's neighbor sibling) but it's sure is the best looking of all three street bridges in the area.
Beautiful bridge from a distance and even better walking across.  Great views of the city in either direction.
Clean and beautiful with a nice walking/bike trail
This is a fine looking bridge that has enabled me to cross the river several times. Fine job to the construction crew and architects who made this possible!
This is a really nice spot for a photo in front of the cbus skyline. This area along the scioto mile is a great little place to take a stroll.

name: Glen Echo Park
address: 510 Cliffside Dr, Columbus, OH 43202, USA
reviews: It's a precious Jewel of Columbus, hidden in quiet area, beautiful at every season.
Very nice place for inside a city. Quiet and secluded in a way

This park was just what I needed today! It's in the low 70s the Sun was shining getting ready to set. There are plenty of bridges in this little Park to take wonderful pictures at the birds have been chirping you can see everything blooming all around you. This is a nice little getaway if you just want to disappear for awhile and have some you time. I would recommend it to anybody.
It was so pretty , there was bridges, pathways into the forest, and a nice little place to camp at as well. We all had an amazing time ! Perfect to bring kids as well☺️

I have to say this is a rather disappointing park. It's quiet and peaceful and a good place to walk your dog if you live in the area. However it's basically just a large open sewer for run off from the areas storm sewers. There are better parks to explore.

name: Jeffrey Park & Mansion
address: 165 N Parkview Ave, Bexley, OH 43209, USA
reviews: Great park, nice wooded trail that takes you down by stream. Mansion is well kept and a   step back in time to gilded past.

This city park is totally unexpected. The old Jeffrey Mansion and grounds are serene break and the hubbub of a city, even in the suburban setting where it lies. Very pleasant walking trails with some athletic facilities and wonderful play space for children.

An absolutely beautiful place, both outside and in. Home of Bexley Parks & Rec offices, this exquisite setting is enjoyable for all ages. There are extensive grassy areas for playing or lawn picnics, paths through woods leading to Alum Creek, sturdy playground equipment, the city-owned outdoor swimming pool, and the updated mansion, which can be rented for private functions. Handicap parking, entry, and restrooms.

Jeffrey's Park and Mansion is a nice place to take a stroll. It has playground areas for youngsters and quite a few miles of walking trails.
