There are white tailed deer on the grounds so don't be surprised if you see one or several. If you enjoy Pokemon Go or Ingress Jeffrey's has quite a few Pokestops and Ingress portals. There are public restrooms available as well as shelters with picnic tables. You will need to bring your own food or drink as no vendors are on site.

- Nice park
- Very clean
- Big area with playgrounds, walking trails, etc 
- Cool castle to see
- Nice area for photography
- Can get busy at times

name: Franklin Park Adventure Center
address: 1755 E Broad St, Columbus, OH 43203, USA
reviews: Asian Festival nice time walking seeing different booths. Sat ate and watched shows on the stage. Need to add more different Asian food vendors

This place has an all handicapped accessible gym! All the same gym equipment you find @ Victories or Planet Fitness, modified so you can wheel right up and get your workout going! And it is ran by fantastic knowledge people who are always willing to help!
My daughter plays 4 foot hoops here.

This weekend the Asian Festival was held at the park. Except for the health screening, it is a magnificent festival. More details to follow, but go!

(Health screening chooses to turn high blood pressure from being the Silent Killer to them saying, "Die already!" First complete a dense four pages which take 10 minutes for a 2-minute BP reading? Typical American health care.)
Provides great experiences for the community in all facets.

name: Hayden Run Falls Park
address: 4460 Hayden Run Rd, Columbus, OH 43221, USA
reviews:
I really enjoy this small kind of hidden park.  Nice location off of Hayden Run Road with space for less than 10 cars.  It is a nice walk down the steps, careful it can be a little slippery, to the boardwalk below.  Probably about 100+ yards on the boardwalk back to the falls.  It is a popular place to take pictures so there will be photographers here from time to time.

Come here after a heavy rain to get a nice view of the water.
Nice quarter mile boardwalk trail. The water might not flow some time but when it flow it is a nice place
It was short and to the point, nice spot for creative B Roll & waterfall nature shots. @otimages for shots I took here!
It's always been a special place. It used to be rough to get to when there was decent rainfall. Now the boardwalk makes it easier to get to.

Such a beautiful place to visit, right in the heart of the city. Easy access and parking and a short walk to get to the falls, have to manage 40 some steps to get up and down in doing so, please ensure that you are in descent health to tackle them . Some planks on the wooden pathway need to be replaced  with the weather beating down on them. Worth the trip!

name: The Refectory Restaurant and Wine Shop
address: 1092 Bethel Rd, Columbus, OH 43220, USA
reviews: Food was amazing. Only downside was the downstairs bathroom is kinda not befitting of a place this nice. They also have a great wine selection and the staff is very helpful. Another  thing I really appreciate is the waiters and waitresses explain everything with great detail. Prices are on the high side but worth it. Check it out for yourself!

One of my all time favorite moments. Came here today for my anniversary dinner with my husband and I was NOT disappointed. The staff were helpful, friendly and professional. They even made us a card for our anniversary and brought us an extra desert with candles! You could tell everyone was expertly trained and they did their job flawlessly. The food was the best I've had anywhere else. The atmosphere was perfect. Everything was perfectly cooked and plated. I will definitely be coming back and recommending it to others.

My girlfriend and I came here for a romantic Valentine's day dinner and couldn't have been more impressed. The food was truly 5 star quality, right along side the service. I even requested a bouquet of white roses be on the table and they set it up perfectly. 
Bear in mind this is every bit a 5 star restaurant, anything less than a collared shirt would stick out and the bill is what you will expect for this kind of food and service.

This is a great place for a special occasion. Our server Eden made the dinner something to remember.  Even surprising us with a great desert selection to cap off our event as a token from the restaurant.
The atmosphere is quiet and upscale while also being rustic. You feel like you are in an old country cottege or building from France. It is great to have a slow paced dinner with friends who want to talk and enjoy company.

The Refectory is likely the best restaurant in Columbus, especially for people who like French cuisine. Its chef was a stident of a French gastronomic legend Paul Bocuse, and it shows. I wish I had enough money to dine at the Refectory often, since every time I go there, I enjoy the food a lot, but also regret that I cannot try everything on the menu which changes regularly. Luckily, my favorite dessert, the warm pear tart, has been offered constantly for the last 3 years. Highly recommended!

name: The Guild House
address: 624 N High St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: I've been here several times and have really enjoyed it each time. The food is familiar but creative and always flavorful. My favorite item is the Lamb burger, this is the best one I've had in Columbus. The atmosphere is upscale and quiet despite being busy and packed. The service is friendly and knowledge but it is not a quick in and out, plan to stay awhile. My son also liked the salmon and fries, the cooks were happy to make the dish plain (no sauces and such) for him.

We’re from out of town in town for a Valentines weekend getaway. We had a great experience for our Valentines dinner with our two toddlers. Beautiful establishment, great service and food was delicious! We loved that were kid friendly! We’ll definitely be back next time we’re in town!

Loved the food (pictured: cheeseburger, chicken roulade, steak salad). Presented beautifully. Tastes great. Perfect portions. And the service was exceptional - adjusted our order based on allergies (shout out to our server Alex W.).

Chelsea was absolutely amazing.  Extremely knowledgeable, very sweet and very personable.  Ambiance and decor was amazing, love this place.  We live 5 hrs away but will definitely be back.  Thank you.

The Guild House was not what I was expecting. Everything we had was really good. The only difficult thing was that it has like tons of words on the menu that aren’t common knowledge. Our group of 5 collectively knew a few, but it was definitely google search while reading the menu. I’ll say that the waiter was excellent. Our cups were never dry. Last piece of advice: not a place for kids. They had no options on the menu for drinks other than alcoholic ones. There were changing tables in the bathrooms, but definitely more of an adult place. Overall, great food and great service.

name: Martini Modern Italian
address: 445 N High St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: My favorite Italian restaurant in the greater Columbus area. I have been there 3 times now and everything I have ordered (cocktails, appetizers, first plates, second plates, and desserts) has been spectacular. If you haven't tried the squash tortellini you should. It is one of the best pasta dishes I have ever had. Service was also top notch. Our server Joe was on point and we lacked for nothing. Wonderful experience. We will be there again for certain. Valet parking is offered and makes parking much easier in this part of the city.

I love Martini’s! It is one of my favorite Cameron Mitchell restaurants. The food is amazing, the service is wonderful and I’ve always had a great experience here. It’s a little pricy but my family loves going here on special occasions.

Really amazing dinner experience with wonderful food and superb wine. Went for a friend's bachelor party and had an amazing meal. The service was great and attentive and the food was out of this world. Everything we had was phenomenal and was cooked to perfection. Make sure to try the fresh mozzarella, it's great!

Dinner at Los Angeles' Providence is an all-evening affair. The service is beautifully orchestrated and the meal is truly the showpiece. Plan to stay for two hours or more, watching as course after course is gracefully presented at each table around you. The mood is festive; since there's a good chance someone in the room is celebrating a birthday or anniversary. For the full experience, arrive a half-hour early and enjoy a deliciously innovative cocktail in the Forbes Travel Guide Four-Star restaurant's lounge. Tailored to the seasons, a savory winter choice includes the “Eskimo,” made with cognac, spiced squash, egg, cream, vanilla and black truffle.

Place was better than expected. We were not sure on portion sizes but they were good. The lamb was so good. If we didn't buy drinks and extra meals we could have walked out of there spending less than 100 $. Service was excellent for how busy it was.

name: The Pearl
address: 641 N High St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: English style pub food. Tables are close together and I did not have enough room under table for my legs. Fiid was delicious. They have a vegetarian shepherdess pie that I ordered topped with a short rib. It was outstanding!

Great atmosphere. The Pearl is a trendy place. It brings in all types of people. The food is fantastic. If you are a seafood lover this would be the place to go. They offer specials on seafood. If you are not into seafood they also have sandwiches and burgers. The mixed drinks are great. The deserts can really make a meal and getting the brown sugar pie slice was truly a topper.

Incredible place. Feels like you're in a different city. The service is outstanding the food is excellent. And the happy hour you cannot beat it. They're incredible Moscow Mules for $5 each. Best Moscow Mule in the city even at full price.

And fresh big pies each day, wow.

Stopped by for dinner during restaurant week.  It was pretty crowded, but the noise level wasn't too bad.  Our waiter was excellent.  He was very personable and knew the menu well.  The jalapeno cornbread appetizer was great, enough for 2 or 3 people.  It wasn't dry like a lot of cornbread.  The fried chicken was juicy and the skin was crispy.  Comes with 4 good sized pieces of chicken.  By the time dessert arrives, I was stuffed and took it home.  The coconut cream pie was tasty.  Definitely recommend The Pearl!
A random Thursday night dinner lead to a nice surprise, $2 oysters! Service was exceptional (Eric). Everything on the menu is a must try. I will definitely be back next visit to Columbus.

name: Barcelona Restaurant and Bar
address: 263 E Whittier St, Columbus, OH 43206, USA
reviews: Excellent food, drinks, and service. Michael, our server was fantastic. He was very helpful in navigating the menu. The grilled octopus tapas and sea scallop main dish was excellent. Great beer and mixed drinks. Delicious deserts. Prices are definitely moderate to expensive. However the quality and portions of food present a good value. Would recommend to anyone who wants a upscale dinning experience.

A memorable night! I highly recommend the pork meatballs — they are exquisitely moist and flavorful, and the accompanying beans are beyond divine. My entree was the veggie paella (with marinated mushrooms and black beans), which exceeded my expectations. Absolutely phenomenal.

Service is top notch (almost to the point of suffocation, but not quite). Just a great spot for a special meal.

The food was delicious, our chef was named Trinity and she was beyond amazing. The service was wonderful and the food was even better than expected. I definitely will be back. Thanks for the great time.

We tried this place out for restaurant week. It was fantastic! My husband and I each tried different items off the prix fixe menu, and they were all amazing! I think they need to have the Blondie with bourbon peaches all the time! The cocktails were also great, and the service impeccable!

My best friend and I stumbled upon this place while we were staying in German Village, and we were absolutely starving. Calamari was wonderful, the hummus was great, but the scallops were hands down the best I’ve ever had. Portions were huge, my friend and I split the scallops entree (they are able to do so with a small fee which is noted in the menu) and it was more than enough for both of us after appetizers. Service was exceptional and the ambience was chic but relaxing. Definitely wanting to visit again!

name: The Thurman Cafe
address: 183 Thurman Ave, Columbus, OH 43206, USA
reviews: Burgers bigger than your head! Delicious too. Not much seating inside, so prepare to wait if you want to sit down. Or go next door to the Pickup Window if you're in more of a hurry. Great place!

Despite not being able to substitute the chips for fries, because kettle chips rip my mouth to shreds, and having to pay extra for said fries, I did like the place and the food. The burger I had was the a-1. It was huge and definitely hand made, like grabbing a hunk of meat and just slapping it on the grill kinda hand made. The fries were really good, not crispy but not mushy. You're typical campus type dive bar with really good food.

Absolutely phenomenal. Fantastic food, great music, very cozy atmosphere. Massive burgers, what else would you want in a cafe!?  Great service? Well they have that too! If you don't walk out feeling like you're about to burst you haven't really been to Thurman cafe! Highly recommend trying it! Will definitely be visiting numerous times.

Fries were hot and tasty! The wait was about to 30 minutes or more on a Wednesday night. But it was worth the wait! Hamburger was delicious I couldn't eat it all ! I think I had the JOHNNY "which was served with a side of TEQUILA & LIME...it also had blue cheese with a horseradish cheese. Small cozy hole in the wall... LOCALS recommended the THURMANATOR !!!

Very small place. Very busy. Large portions. Had the Rad Shroom burger. Very tasty. Didn't have enough horseradish sauce for my taste. Excellent fries. Good service. Music selection was all over the place, from country to new age.

name: Skillet
address: 410 E Whittier St, Columbus, OH 43206, USA
reviews: Easily some of the best food and drinks I have ever had. The food was perfectly cooked and I can only describe it as delicious. The drinks were a perfect balance of flavor. Our waitress was wonderful and friendly as well as the bartender. You couldn't go wrong with what you order.

If you want amazing farm to table brunch, then Skillet is for you! Absolutely delicious food, it does has a small sitting area so unless you come early expect to wait a while. It is definitely worth the wait! They change up the menu regularly, and everything I've tried has been mind-numbingly amazing. Excellent service and  staff, I cannot recommend this establishment enough.

Consistently the BEST breakfast in Columbus and it's not even that close. In my experience, the staff is friendly, attentive and familiar with the menu. I've never been disappointed when ordering based on their recommendation. The menu is always changing and even when I order something I don't think seems like it would be my taste it's absolutely delicious. I can't recommend Skillet enough.  If you live near Columbus and haven't tried it stop waiting.

This is a wonderful little restaurant. There is not much room inside, so waits could be long. It is worth it, though. They have a fairly unique menu and said much of the food on their menu is farm to table. The staff was friendly and helpful. I highly recommend trying it.

One of my favorite breakfast places in Columbus! Their food is always great. I would call it a fine dining quality food in a casual setting. Their menu does change, which makes it a treat to try something different every time I go there. They do have a small sitting space and a line in front most of the times they are open. I would argue this is what makes Skillet so attractive, it is a part of the whole experience. It makes this place feel more cozy and food taste better when you finally get inside. And, in my experience, their stuff is always super nice and friendly :) Kudos to the chef and owner!

name: Schmidt’s Sausage Haus und Restaurant
address: 240 E Kossuth St, Columbus, OH 43206, USA
reviews: Found ourselves downtown after visiting the Home and Flower show, and not wanting to eat junk, decided to stop in at Schmidt's restaurant in German Village.  Although it was Sunday afternoon, which is a popular time, my wife and I were seated in less than 5 minutes and enjoyed sampling all the choices in their Sunday buffet.  Food was excellent and the service exceptional.  Many of the servers have worked there a long time and really know how to treat good customers well.  They definitely remember who are the good tippers.  It is a great place to take families. Will definitely come back.

Sausage Heaven! One of my most favorite places to go in the world! Walk in and you are overcome with the smell of sizzling sausage in an entertaining, lively environment. Happy servers, oompah music, authentic decor and delicious food! The Autobahn All-You-Can-Eat Buffet, at $15.99, is unbeatable, loaded with a succulent assortment of tender sausages (with a perfect snap) and German fixings! Wash it down with a couple of Large German draft beers! Don't forget the cream puffs!!

I LOVED the energy of the space and place! Dinner was awesome! Service was prompt but not rushed. Food was incredible. I wish I had taken pics. 

Don't neglect to take time to shop down the street at both the fudge shop across the street and also the artisan's gallery two blocks down.  This is an awesome area of the city!

Enjoy!

The food and ambience were good.  Loved the historical details.  My only drawback was the waitstaff.  I think our waitress must have been having an off-day as she checked on us the absolute minimum number of times and then brought the check before we ordered dessert.  Needless to say that the check was brought promptly again when she brought our desserts.  No refills offered and a "hurry up, eat, and leave" feeling.  I did not get this impression from other staff.  So, five stars.

We come here whenever we're in Columbus. Great atmosphere and good old German fare including lots of cabbage, potatoes and sausage. And German beer!  Prices and service are good. We often go for the buffet but the menu is extensive and good. Don't skip the homemade cream puff or German chocolate cake for dessert. Can be pretty crowded but we don't care.

name: Rodizio Grill - Columbus
address: 125 W Nationwide Blvd, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: Came with a big group for lunch. The buffet has a good selection of salads and sides. True to Brazilian Steakhouse style, the servers bring skewers of meat  to slice at the table. The food was all well prepared - the sides had great flavor and variety while the meats had various spices. Everyone in our party was satisfied and stuffed.

So delicious and you leave satisfied and filled. This place is amazing, filled with a wonderful staff and a plentiful amount of options at the salad bar accompanied with several savory options of meats. We were greeted in and felt very comfortable in the atmosphere. The location was extremely clean including their restrooms. The server instantly noticed I was brazillian and I was quite impressed with her observation. She remained very nice and extremely helpful making sure we knew the process and were familiar with everything else. She was definitely a highlight of our visit and we were very please by her service. The side items brought out were not only bottomless but delicious. Of course, the steak, the main course was fantastic and was cooked to our preference. I loved every single moment of this visit and will be coming back again soon. Thank you so much!

The Rodizio Grill was a great experience and the first time I was offered fish at at a Churrascaria, and I’ve been to several. The fish was a nice touch. The Gauchos were tentative and made their way to my table in a timely manner. One of the best experiences I’ve had visiting Brazilian Steakhouses. Unlike some Brazilian Steakhouses, Rodizio offers fountain soft drinks instead of individual canned drinks which is nice considering the cost of the meal per person, for me, I went to dinner and it was $36.99 before tax and tip. I would love to revisit this location or another in its franchise.

Amazing experience! The staff was super friendly and made us have a wonderful time dining. Isaiah was especially awesome and extra attentive to what we liked. The food was super yummy too! Highly recommend!

My wife and I loved it, but if you don't like Brazilian cuisine then you may not. But my wife and I have visited Brazil and I thought it was pretty authentic. But I have read some reviews on here that said otherwise, but I am sure they have never been anywhere in their lives but the Ohio dump. Even if you are looking to try something unique and different besides your typical American cuisine, it's worth a one time visit. I end all of my reviews with the same reminder. If you find yourself in the Dayton dump, keep your expectations very low and you won't be disappointed.

name: Lindey's
address: 169 E Beck St, Columbus, OH 43206, USA
reviews: First time there after several recommendations and it's no wonder why it's one of the top restaurants in Columbus. German Village is made better by Lindeys' atmosphere. The food is incredible; not a single entree or appetizer in our 6-top was below average. All the cocktails were too notch, heavy pours. Don't let the prices deter you because you will leave satisfied and wanting to come back.

AJ was a fabulous server! He took his time and made sure we had everything we needed. He also described the dishes and was very personable. The food was outstanding! Definitely stop by and check this gem out. I would recommend it for a romantic dinner or quality family time. Beautiful.

Lindey's is great! The Tempura Cauliflower appetizer is a must anytime we go there. Perfect for lunch, dinner, work meetings, anything. Everyone is always satisfied. And if you have the opportunity, the patio is one of the best I have ever seen. Hot chicken sandwich and burger are always a great go to for lunch. Their pasta dishes are a favorite for dinner time

Had a delicious dinner here for our last night in Columbus.  I ordered a pomegranate mule, which was so good I ordered another!  For my entree, I opted for Australian Sea Bass which was pretty good.  I  will admit I envied my husband's choice if steak fritters, as it was most delicious as was the sauce that accompanied it.  Our table was a bit too close to the hostess station for comfort, but otherwise a very nice atmosphere for dinner.
Fantastic dining experience for brunch and dinner!  Set in the heart of the gorgeous German Village, sitting outside by the fountain in the warm months is a great time.

name: Polaris Grill
address: 1835 Polaris Pkwy, Columbus, OH 43240, USA
reviews:
Great place 
Very reserved.
Good and romantic for dates. 
Very clean and organized.
Lovely and professional staffs.
Tasty meals with variety of options. 
Different drinks to pick from.
Go there and see for yourself.
I enjoy the setup and the food, have always been able to accommodate our larger than average parties. Foods good and the menu has good variety so everything can find something.

We've eaten here enumerable times including company affairs and have never been disappointed 
However my wife ordered takeout Saturday after working at Costco where she manages the flowers 
Obviously valentine's is a busy week so we celebrate the day after  The crab cakes were marginal and small and my favorite dish shrimp and scallops new Orleans wasn't very good either  The only items worthwhile were the 55 salad .  Needless to say we were not pleased
The food and service are both excellent if a little pricey.   We ordered two meals, no appetizers, no alcohol, and the bill was still close to $100.00.  Nice place if you can afford it.

Great place to take a date. Lighting is dim and very relaxed atmosphere. Wait staff were professional and courteous, offering to suggest meals, if needed. Prices are pretty much in the $25-35 range with several items under $20. I had walleye amandine, which came with risotto and veggies. It was all amazingly good. There was enough food that I had leftovers to make lunch the next day. I noticed two very long family tables in a separate area. I will definitely return for special nights out.

name: J. Gilbert's Wood Fired Steaks & Seafood Columbus
address: 1 E Campus View Blvd, Columbus, OH 43235, USA
reviews: For our anniversary we decided to order dinner from J. Gilbert's--curbside pick up. It was the best decision we could have made! The entire process from placing the order to picking it up was seamless and efficient.  We can't say enough about the food. Everything was fresh, prepared well, and absolutely delicious. We ordered the crab cakes along with some lobster mac and cheese. Oh my! We are originally from Maryland and these crab cakes brought back happy memories of the famous Maryland Crab cakes we used to love. We will definitely be ordering food from here again, and we can't wait to be able to actually dine in (someday!).

We have been here before and they made me an offer that I couldn't refuse---a Birthday coupon! The food, ambiance and service are excellent. A word of advice concerning sauces is to try a sample before putting any on your dish. The crab cake sauce and the house steak sauce are both too hot in our opinion.

Cannot believe I have not reviewed this place! This place is truly a hidden GEM. My family, friends and I have been going here for the last 8 years or so and our waitress, KIM, always takes such good care of us. Last night we went back after having not been for several months and she still remembered my drink order and how I liked my Salad. WOW. Great and very unique wood fired Steak, very high quality food and by far the best service of any Steak house in the city. I am continually unimpressed by places boasting better food and costing twice the price. They may say they are better but they aren't. Despite being in this location for more than a decade the place is always very clean and very well presented. A must for date night. 5 stars! Ask for KIM, tell her Tim sent you :-)

This place is the best steak house in all of Columbus.  The staff is there to always help you and make great recommendation.  The atmosphere is what you think a steak house should be.  The chocolate cake is maybe the best dessert I have ever had.  The steak is always done to perfection and needs no extra sauces.  When they bring the bread try the pastrami butter.
Fantastic food! Easily one of the best steaks I've ever had. Wonderful service and atmosphere. I can't wait to come back!

name: Lavash Cafe
address: 2985 N High St, Columbus, OH 43202, USA
reviews:
One of the best if not the best Mediterranean restaurants in town. The staff is super helpful and accommodating. Food is absolutely delicious. Ambience is nice. Ample of space. Centrally located near OSU campus and easy to spot from the main road. 

Note to Owner: The back room for eating doesn't have the same ambience as main hall and needs work.

We are not residents of the Columbus area. We were in town for business and were looking for a lunch place that served great Mediterranean food. I looked on Trip Advisor and found this place. It was truly outstanding! The food and service were exceptional! We will be returning on our next trip to Columbus.

We love Lavash! We always get the chicken with rice and onion slices and that amazing cream on the side. It's just delicious. I'm sure that, just like any great restaurant, everything is equally delicious there. The service is very good and it's a very international place.

We ordered something wrongly. The owner and employees handled the situation promptly and kindly. They offered to replace it with what we wanted. Amazing customer service! We left pleased. Don’t hesitate coming here.

The best Lebanese Restaurant in the States.
The food is delicious, amazing staff and very clean facilities.

name: Firebirds Wood Fired Grill
address: 8760 Sancus Blvd, Columbus, OH 43240, USA
reviews:
I went here for a quick bite after a long day at work.  I was a bit stressed as I was only just getting to go to lunch at 4:30 PM after starting my shift at 8:30 AM.  However, once I sat down by the fireplace and was greeting by my awesome waiter who put me at ease. and a wonderfully prepared old fashioned was brought out to me, all my of stress began to melt away.  

I rarely say anything about restaurant ambiance but I really felt this place a standout in this department.  Between the very cool looking bar, the nice warm fireplace, the friendly and welcoming staff, I think this was one of the best locations I've been to so far in Columbus in those categories.  

The food was a happy hour selection and I chose the ribs.  Depending on your preference, this may not be the ribs of choice.  As far as I could tell it was a brown sugar based glaze with a touch of maple syrup, which seemed like a bit of an odd combination at first.  However, the meat was just falling off the bones and after the initial surprise, I really warmed up to the taste.  Half delicious dessert, half delicious ribs, making for a delicious dish.  I had a side fries that were freshly prepared to go along with it.  

This was just an excellent dining experience in all regards.  I will say the prices outside of happy hour can get moderately expensive.  However, based on the experience I had, I'm rather looking forward to trying the more expensive items on the menu when I come back.  Would recommend: 5/5, will be back.

I was looking for a good steak house and I find it here. I felt so comfortable, like I was sitting at a friend's house having dinner. That's how awesome my waiter was. Everything that came out of the kitchen was spectacular. The Philly cheese steak egg rolls and the Delmonico steak were of my favorite.

The atmosphere is really nice.  The fireplace, even though you aren't always near it, gives a great ambiance to the place.  Service was fast, maybe a little pushy but quick and efficient.  Orders were brought out accurately which was nice.  Pricing may be a little high for what you receive but sometimes you pay for the atmosphere.  I will go back one try the pizza next time.

Typically not a huge fan of chain restaurants but this menu is banging and most items I have ordered seem to be made reasonably fresh upon order. Deviled eggs are literally the best. The Delmonico steak is great. The meatloaf is top notch, the drinks are made by well trained bar hands. For the price relative to other chain restaurants, Firebirds is in a league of 1

We just moved to the Columbus area and myself and my husband wanted to find a nice restaurant for just the two of us to go to for special occasions throughout the year. We chose Firebirds restaurant for our date night tonight to see if this could be our restaurant. From the moment we walked in the door until we left we were smiling and happy. I would like to focus mostly on our sever, Alexander,  although the greeters, bartenders, and other staff were amazing and welcoming as well. Alexander was extremely friendly!! He was definitely an ambassador for your restaurant. From the drinks to the food he knew all about how amazing each thing tasted and was able to recommend without us having to sit and think and make a decision. The martinis were amazing and are my new favorite. We’ve lived here for about 7 months and have not received the type of service like we got from Alexander. Alexander along with his manager Erich and other co workers, are the reason we’ve chosen your restaurant as our new “special occasion” and maybe a few times in between, restaurant. Thank you for making our evening so great!!!

name: Mitchell's Ocean Club
address: 4002 Easton Station, Columbus, OH 43219, USA
reviews:
Years ago, it was only special occasions that I would venture across the city.  Not anymore, this is an excellent seafood restaurant... one of the best!
It’s classy, sophisticated... the servers and bar staff are professional and fun! So now I’m there now on a regular basis(4x/month)... and when I’m in Naples, I also go! 
Exceptional food and service!

Wow. What a great seafood restaurant. Very professional and knowledgable servers. Great ambience and location. I tried the Chilean Sea Bass which was cooked perfectly, presented eloquently and was a nice serving size. I also tried an old fashioned cocktail, and the table shared some parmesan fries. Overall it's a great restaurant for special occasions, or just a great night with great food.

My boyfriend and I had our 4 year anniversary dinner at this restaurant and absolutely loved it, came back today 1/16/20 just because we loved it so much and got engaged here. This place will forever be special to us and we will continue to come back, our waitresses were AWESOME! So sweet and so informative and very attentive. The food is always amazing!! I wish I could remember our waitresses name because she was so sweet and they even gave us free champagne for our engagement!  forever thankful to Mitchell’s Ocean Club.

Without a doubt the best Ranch I have ever had. Their Ranch has changed me. Colors are more vivid, my smile is wider, my friends say my skin is glowing. I was hesitant to ask for Ranch at such a nice place but I am so glad I did. Please try their Ranch, its especially good with the parmesan truffle fries. 10/10

Great seafood restaurant. One of the best I've ever been too. I love their selection of food. I had the lobster bisque and crab cakes for appetizers, and they were both fantastic. For my main course I had the twin lobster tails which were also really good. And for dessert I had the butter cake which was delicious, the best dessert item they have. I love this restaurant.

name: Valters at the Maennerchor
address: 976 S High St, Columbus, OH 43206, USA
reviews: This place was really very enjoyable. The food was fantastic and the serving size was more than adequate. The price was more than I had expected, but what youorder to eat is well worth it. I would eat there again and plan to do so. I am planning to take my friends and relatives there to treat them to some amazing food. The desserts are also very good and taste amazing too.

Food is good. Portions are not very large, I'd say a bit overpriced given the amount of food. The menu needs more variety, despite being typical for what a restaurant in Germany would have. Good selection of beers on tap. The hefeweisen is great. I heard a waiter mention that they have Budweiser in bottles. Get rid of it. You can't have real beer and Budweiser at the same time.

One of the best steaks I've had in Columbus coupled with good wine and pleasant atmosphere. This cozy, hole in the wall spot in German Village doesn't get enough respect. If you're looking to get away from the crowd or an enjoyable date night, look no further.

The first time my wife and I tried Valters, we were so obsessed that we went back 3 more times that week. Almost a year later, it’s still one of our favorite restaurants in Columbus. Overall a delicious and authentic German dining experience. I have a vacation rental property in German Village, and a few of our guests have actually traveled here and booked our place just to try Valter’s. Highly recommended.

The best authentic German cuisine I've ever had. The German potato salad here is on a whole other level than all others. The pretzel rolls are fantastic. The food was flavorful and done to perfection. Staff was super friendly and allowed us to try beer before ordering. And yes, you do have room for the cream puffs.

name: Wolf's Ridge Brewing
address: 215 N 4th St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: Absolutely love this place, one of my favorite restaurants in the city!  Was busy on a Saturday night, but got in immediately with a reservation.  The duck confit was juicy and tasty.  The pork tenderloin was cooked perfectly and seasoned well.  The lamb was so tender it didn't require a knife.  The beer is awesome too!  Service was friendly and attentive.  I can't wait to come back.

In my top 2 favorite breweries for Columbus. Pub fare in the back with restaurant option in the front. Always have 18 WR taps and 4 wines on menu. Garlic fries are good and conveniently located by PINS, elevator tap and platform if your looking to hang out longer. Half a mile from arena district as well

The restaurant was so good, our staff was so nice. We went there for brunch on Saturday, they're busy!

My husband got Croque Madame with garlic fries. It was huge but so good. Duck egg made everything so smooth, I like his food more than mine 🤣

I got Toad in the Hole, it was good too but in my opinion the bread was dry I just don't like the texture that much, but don't get me wrong, I ate them all and ate my husband's too!

The garlic fries is👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻 the dish was clean and their OJ is fresh pressed, so yum, finally I found a good fresh pressed OJ ($4)

Overall this place is good, will comeback for sure!
Awesome experience. Received beer delivery up to the Akron area. Keep brewing and thank you again!
Great beers and excellent bar. The food was well prepared, hot with excellent service. The staff was fantastic and friendly. Can't wait to go back.Highly Recommend!!!

name: Bakersfield Short North Temporarily Closed
address: 733 N High St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: Stumbled upon this place last summer when we were in town for a concert and it was the first place we stopped upon our return this year. Everything we've tried has been great (guac, salsas, tacos, Johnny salad and the margaritas). Get the pineapple margarita spicy... Worth the extra dollar. We'll be back!

Had dinner here last night with high Hope's after reading reviews. Must have been an off night or our server was new. It was a chore to order a beer if you actually care about what kind of beer you are getting. Asked the server if there was anything on tap that wasn't on the menu. He says no. So I asked about the Madtree seasonal and he proceeds to pull out a hand written list with several beers that weren't on the menu. If you have rotating taps just print a real beer menu that is up to date. Then they brought me the wrong beer. 
We ordered our meals and they bring everything out of big platters.  Would be much better to just plate the food. We had a large party so they brought half our food at a time and had to switch players out so we could serve ourselves es our tacos. Not extremely enjoyable but tacos were pretty good. No real reason to come back.
Always enjoyed this place. Tacos are good. Good for hanging out with friends. Good for bite and quick drinks. Better to call in before you go during rush hours.

This is most likely going to my go to place for happy hour spot since I work 10min away in Short North AND for Brunch. I mean what can I say about this marvelous establishment. The staff is great, the food is amazing.  It's a random goal of mine so we'll see what happens.
Tacos and queso were very good. The margaritas were amazing! Definitely will be back.

name: Z Cucina di Spirito
address: 1368 Grandview Ave, Columbus, OH 43212, USA
reviews: Had to see what the number 1 restaurant in Columbus, Ohio was all about. Italian theme with a wonderful evening to enjoy dinner on the patio. I loved the Lasagna and the cheesecake was perfect. Loved the marshmallow on top along with salted caramel and raspberries. Look for Glory as she is such a nice person and made the visit a very enjoyable experience.

The main dish does not meet my expectation. They have more space to improve the taste to match their price. But the meatball is very delicious! We have lots of choices for wine. And servant is really nice but the dish is a little bit slow when coming from kitchen.

Ordered pickup at 4:30 for 6:15. Got here at 6:15. Didn’t receive food until 7:25. The food was fantastic, as usual, and they tried to make it right.  That said, the pickup business model needs a lot of tweaking.

Wonderful service and staff. The food is really great. I tried something from the temporary menu. The chef who designed it is obviously skilled, although there were a few parts to the dish that I did not like. Mainly, I thought the smoked shrimp tasted odd and wasn't a great method to cook it. The flavoring it added to the risotto was incredible, but the smokey flavor on the shrimp itself tasted clashing with its natural flavor. The tomato salsa on this dish was absolutely perfect and the fish was light and crispy - delicious! It was really neat to try something that was creative and fun, and I would definitely come back to see what else the restaurant has to offer.

Absolutely one of the BEST Italian restaurant in Columbus. Hands down! Not only was the food absolutely amazing and well worth the money but the staff was so accommodating and on top of everything. Highly recommend if you're looking for a fancy place for dinner or to celebrate something romantic. Highly recommend!!

name: Basi Italia
address: 811 Highland St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: Small. Seats about 30 in upstairs dining. Can be drafty near window during cold weather. Thoughtful & ever-changing Italian focused menu, including specials. There can be misses, but mostly home runs. Downstairs bar and seating. Great cocktails & wine selections. Additional seating Outdoors weather permitting. $10 valet parking if you don't have cbus parking app. Vacated giant eagle parking lot may be a free option 2 blocks away. Reservations are highly recommended.
Amazing! The drinks were on point. Service was top notch. Can't say enough good things about the food. Already excited to go back!

Small, noisy, parking is a pain, but the food is on point. Started off with the mussels and though I'm not big on tomato based, these were excellent. I had ordered the short ribs but the waiter came back and said they were out so I landed on the the lamb chops. If the short ribs are anywhere as good as the lamb chops are, I can't wait to go back. Surprisingly, the prices are very reasonable for the quality, the latter about as close to a five star as I would give a restaurant.

I've eaten here three times and each of the three times, my entree was absolutely perfect.  Our server (Kaitlyn was it?) was fantastic.  The atmosphere is like nothing else with its small, cozy dining room which is basically a large living room.  This is my go-to special occasion restaurant.

Best restaurant in Columbus hands down.  Whitney was our server and she took great care of us! She was on top of her game like I've never seen anyone! Ask for her when you come here. You won't regret it! The food is EXCELLENT! There are alot of good restaurants in Columbus but they are mediocre compared to Basi Italia! Waaaaay under-rated in this city! The service, food, and wine selection is out of this world! A Columbus hidden gem that should be beating out places like Lindy's and the Pearl   no question! Thank you Whitney for making our anniversary dinner wonderful! We will definitely be coming back!

name: The Melting Pot
address: 4014 Townsfair Way, Columbus, OH 43219, USA
reviews: Absolutely amazing experience, that has to be on everyone's bucket list!  Can be quite romantic, or a fun visit for a small group of 4-6

Great spot for an intimate girls night out. Cocktails, cheese and chocolate was fun and delicious. Had fantastic service from Brandon. Classic Alpine and Wisconsin cheddar cheese fondues with all yummy dippers. Original chocolate and peanut butter and the white chocolate bananas foster dessert fondues with the add on dippers. Love the macarons and cheesecake. Highly recommended the Love Martini if you like a sweet and fruity cocktail

The good- our waiter was wonderful. The food was tasty, my favorite being the chocolate fondue. 

The bad- 
I basically paid $100 for two people to cook my own food with portions that would cost about $10 max if I bought them at a grocery store. Ridiculous. $22 for 3 shrimp, 3 small (I'm talking like pink eraser size) pieces of steak, chicken, and salmon. The best steakhouses in Columbus serve bigger portions and cook it for you! This really is my biggest gripe. I can cook my own food at home, the "experience" isn't worth the cost by a long shot. Actually buying a hot plate and double boiling the ingredients yourself at home would have been more cost effective. 

The front desk attendant was extremely rude and cannot string together an intelligible sentence. She mumbled and gestured at us after rolling her eyes when the other host told her to seat us with our group. 

All of my clothes and coat had to be washed thoroughly as they smelled to high heaven after leaving. The place should probably have better ventilation if there's going to be steam all over. It really does cling to your clothing.  

All around-
We had fun but I wouldn't go again.

The experience was great. It was fun and romantic just doing the fondue. My husband and I enjoyed it. Service was excellent but for the price the quality of the food needs to be greatly improved. And the atmosphere could be much nicer.

The Melting Pot is an awesome experience and so fun. I feel it is very romantic with a significant other! It is a little pricy, however the experience is worth it! I have only been twice but the staff both times were out of this world!

name: Hyde Park Prime Steakhouse
address: 569 N High St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: Went last night for our 3rd year anniversary and had such an excellent time. Great friendly staff that took amazing care of us and made the experience so special. The food was so amazing. It was the best steaks we have ever had. Definitely would go back and recommend others to go.

I got to experience Hyde Park at a lovely event as part of a private group. The atmosphere is beautiful, the dim lights and fresh white tablecloths fit the mood of the restaurant perfectly. All the food was wonderful and the care put into every detail was stunning. Every member of staff we spoke to was friendly, knowledgeable, and very professional. I would highly recommend this Columbus staple for any private event or party.

The food was absolutely amazing. They have a broiler for there steaks so it instills a really nice char to the beef. The service was wonderful. They'll bring out the Japanese Wagyu before its cooked to inspect the marbling. I will be returning soon.
A great place to have dinner with a beautiful atmosphere. The staff were all friendly and helpful. We celebrated our anniversary and they helped make it even more special. Thank you!

It was my 23rd birthday and the food was so amazing. Drinks were really strong too. I believe a manager actually took the time to help our table, we had a party of 10. It was my first time at a really nice steak house and I will be back for sure. We got a free dessert and it was the BEST dessert I've ever had in my life. I highly suggest to anyone looking for a fancy night out to go to this place. The restaurant made my birthday amazing. Thank you!

name: Scotty's Cafe
address: 2980 E Broad St, Columbus, OH 43209, USA
reviews: The service right when I walked in was top notch. Greeted very friendly. The service was very good & quick. She was super nice and kept my coffee full the entire time. The breakfast was great. But the French Toast was the best I’ve ever had. It was out of this world good. Yes his will definitely be my new local spot.

Scotty's Cafe was delicious! I tried the tomato basil soup and pastrami reuben. Everything made in house. Service was fast, friendly and efficient. Greeted warmly by all staff members including owners Scott and Gina. Gina even reviewed the menu with us! Drinks refilled quickly and we never felt rushed to leave. We were actually encouraged to sit and relax. It is a must try! I will definitely be back and bring other family members to enjoy!

Very good food at a good price. Good portion size and well displayed. The small space filled fast for lunch. The owner came out to personally check on every single person. Great attention to detail. Friendly, caring staff.

I travel a lot for work and always try to hit local diners, I’ve been to diners all over New England, New York, Pennsylvania and now Ohio and this has been one of the best overall experiences (food and hospitality) I’ve ever received. 

Thank you to the entire staff for their hard work and tasty food!

I discovered this fantastic little diner with very friendly service while passing through on my way back home to Indiana. All of the staff worked together to ensure the customers are taken care of.  The owner made it a point to stop by every table and knew right away that I was a newbie. We chatted a bit and I discovered that everything in the diner is made fresh, including the various breads that are made onsite. The food was delicious and my experience ended with a wonderful chocolate chip cookie for me to take with me on my trip back home. So glad that I got to experience the wonderful hospitality and amazing food that they offered. If I'm ever back in town, I definitely will stop by again.

We stayed in Columbus last night and this morning I googled breakfast near me. This was one of the first places on the list with 4.9 stars. Unheard of! Google also said the place was similar to Lincoln’s Waffle Shop which is one of my favorite places in DC. It did not disappoint. The coffee was delightful. I ordered a veggie omelette and my husband got the French toast. My omelette was good. We both agreed the French toast was the best we’d ever had. The service was wonderful. Staff was friendly and attentive. We even got free cookies for the ride home. Will definitely be back.

name: Brassica in the Short North
address: 680 N High St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: The food was amazing. However, deep in my dish I found this metal piece in my food and almost swallowed it. Thank God I coughed it up. It could have messed up my esophagus or stomach. I want to eat here again but is it safe????

The best Mediterranean food!! So fresh, and so many ingredients to pick from! You can tell they really take the time to not only create great options to pick from but make them absolutely delicious! Staff is so friendly and knowledgeable. Cannot wait for things to open back up because the ambiance in this restaurant in general is fresh, modern, and inviting!

Amazing. They were super accommodating for a work lunch. Food was delivered on time, without issue and was delicious. Great option for allergies/vegetarians. Also - their online menu was super easy to use/navigate and place an order - loved the family style options - made it so easy to please a large group!

Very good, 4.5 stars for what it is. But then again, what exactly is this place? 

Just had lunch here and it was great, it seems young people and hipsters give it five stars.  But perhaps old crusty folks such as myself will experience a limited menu, or maybe be a little confused.

For example, it appears the main act here is Mediterranean type pitas, or you can deconstruct that into a salad bowl. The pitas are great, warm, fresh, and they have pickled cabbage, feta, tahini sauce, hummus, things you get with Mediterranean street food. 

But the meat choices are… Southern? Like brisket, and caramelized bacon.  The brisket was really good, lean and flavorful, no disappointment at all.

But still a little different combination and a little different kind of deli. Limited seating, small tables, you do your own table busing.

Real food, really really good! I suspect, from the fabulous bright flavors that I'd never run into anything microwaved or out of a packet here, and that the food had low to no additives (as I try to stick with over 99% of the time). Also thrilled to find that they are sourcing such high quality ingredients, that there was Real Salt, (although my food was already perfectly spiced) and very clear allergen information for several different allergies!

name: Forno Kitchen + Bar
address: 721 N High St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: Best happy hour ever! Half off the majority of their menu from 4-6pm including cocktails. Servers, at the bar, are very attentive even in the chaos of happy hour! Food was delicious and definitely enough to share.

I go here for happy hour after work quite often and it's dope! Half off great tasting cocktails, appetizers, and pizza keeps me coming back. The service is also A1 and we're always taken care of. 

It can be a bit busy though so you might have to be comfortable with chilling at the bar unless you call ahead of time.

Not worth it. The chicken was dry and the food over seasoned with garlic.  Pizza was not up to snuff.  A bit soggy in the middle. It wasn't that expensive and the service was good, but I would have rather gone elsewhere. (Also this is def an Italian place, not 'New American')

Very cool atmosphere, great service and tasty food.  I had the carne pizza with artichokes.  Crust was nice and crispy and the pizza held together nicely.  It was large enough to have leftovers the next day.  Drinks were great as well!  I can't wait to go back.
Went here for a birthday brunch last year with friends, and it was great! Food was delicious and the service was great! I’ve been other times, with good service and food, as well!

name: Milestone 229
address: 229 S Civic Center Dr, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: Milestone 229 is an amazing restaurant in a fantastic location. Its sits right in the Bicentennial Park and has an amazing view of the the Scioto River. Myself and a group of work colleagues ventured to Milestone for dinner and we were all impressed with the service and food offerings. We were able to select entries from burgers to short ribs to shrimp and grits. The libations were top notch and I would personally recommend the Manhattan. I left this establishment with a phenomenal restaurant to add to my list of places to return. 5 Stars.

great food, a bit of the pricey side but really good. good views of the park during the day and awesome outdoor seating. Make sure to get a reservation as they fill up quick. also , kind of a short menu so look ahead of time to make sure there is something that interests you. Valet available out front.

Great location (though parking can be a hassle) and very comfortable at both inside and outside seating. Sat outside for brunch and had very good, meaty sandwich. Everyone really enjoyed their food, and the staff was polite. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

Milestone 229 has fantastic food at very reasonable prices. This restaurant offers a great menu that doesn’t get overly complicated. I have never had a bad meal here and anything that I choose is always excellent. This is a fantastic place for a date night or an evening out. The restaurant has a lovely atmosphere and the quality of the food sets this place apart from other restaurant. Fantastic!
Recommended by a dear friend and they were spot on ! Milestone 229was awesome. .best I’ve ever had.  very good. Service good. Not your average dining experience, but far below Fine Dining pricing.

name: M at Miranova
address: 2 Miranova Pl, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: Excellent food, drinks, and service.  Celebrated our wedding anniversary with dinner and it was  fantastic. The service was everything you expect from a fine dining experience. I had a surf and turf while my wife ordered veal. It was some of the best food we ever had.

Presentation was eye art and everything tasted as great as it looked.  Staff was helpful.  Will go again.   Restaurant is fairly small and intimate,  reservations are must.  Would love to watch fireworks from their outdoor patio.

Honestly the best service I have ever received!!!! The food was phenomenal but the service was out of this world! I would most definitely recommend. If you want a quiet place I would direct you not to go here. It’s a busy place so therefore noise levels come with that! You won’t be disappointed!

First time being here since the remodel and menu update. From traditional steak house to modern flare, M has flipped itself around. Food is prepared perfectly, but flavors are unique and may require an open mind compared to the old stuff. I'm glad they updated but want to see if they fine tune their flavor choices in the future. Great time either way and glad we went back!
The best restaurant experience you can have in Columbus!  Now a 4 diamond restaurant, the best around!  Cameron Mitchell at it's best.

name: The Top Steak House
address: 2891 E Main St, Columbus, OH 43209, USA
reviews:
Love the ambiance of this place and I also love that the steaks come with large onion rings.  The steak itself is simply seasoned - I like mine with a little more oomph.  I ordered mine cooked more well done than my husband but his was cooked more well done which annoyed him.   The broccoli has no seasoning or butter, making it nothing special. The Mac n cheese was perfectly delicious. 

We’ve been going to the Top for several years and I feel like the food “taste” is not quite what it used to be.  Would love to see some improvements.

The best meal I’ve ever had!!! Ripeye steak and onion rings are below my mind😍Steak was cooked medium well and onion rings were crispy but not oily at all. Love their soufflé too,crispy on top but soft inside. Good vibes with old songs and bartenders treated us well. We enjoyed our meals and will definitely come back

The Top is unique among steakhouses in Columbus. It is an unapologetic step back in time to the late fifties and early sixties. The only thing missing is the cigar/cigarette smoke. The wait staff is attentive and knowledgeable. The steaks are on par with the other high end steakhouses. The bone marrow appetizer was a real treat. It was done really well with a bacon red pepper relish. The high point for me was the cocktails. They are head and shoulders better than the other steakhouses in town. My wife and I were skeptical about The Top because of the area of town it is in, but it really is one of the best steakhouses in Columbus and we will be back.

......The atmosphere is great, which earns this place its only two stars. While the Kansas City Dry Aged Steak is FANTASTIC, that's about it. I won't visit again after my meal tonight. $51 for lobster tail that tasted like a car tire (I literally counted to 32 seconds of chewing) on top of my $42 steak (that was the steak and lobster dinner) Yes my Steak and lobster was over $100 (I normally don't ask for $$ at MP, but I usually don't expect it to be gross) In the end I paid for everything because I should have mentioned something earlier... but $100 for a single plate on this side of town is atrocious when the food (except the one steak) is mediocre at best.

One of the best steaks I've ever had. If you want to go to old Vegas but can't travel back on time, this is the place for you. You can almost see Frankie and Dean smoking in the corner booth. Great service and the food is terrific

name: Cap City Fine Diner and Bar
address: 1299 Olentangy River Rd, Columbus, OH 43212, USA
reviews: This is a good spot.  Showed up on a week night with a big group, and this place was hopping.  I expected slow service but was pleasantly surprised, very energetic staff.  The food is delicious.  I sampled multiple dishes and saw many more at our large table and was very impressed.  I like places like this.  They have an adequate menu and do it well, as opposed to offering everything imaginable and average food.  Definitely be back.  Give ‘em a try.

This place is amazing. It has been spectacular every time I've come. Excellent service. Really friendly people work here. And the food and their attention to allergies is off the charts fantastic. I cannot recommend it highly enough. And they have dishes that you normally just cannot get gluten free. Like a cheese steak sandwich and beer battered fish and chips. Love love love it here! And they are very careful with allergies. When you come at dinner they even have dinner rolls that are gluten free. Today I came on a Sunday afternoon and they had fresh hot delicious cinnamon rolls. This place is the best. Wish I didn't live an hour and a half away.

The perfect lunch spot. I only say that because I've only ever been there for lunch since it's close to my office and I live far outside town. I can only believe it's a great dinner spot as well. I like to try something new off the menu every place I go more than once. More often than not I get burned by that mindset, sadly. My fault for liking variety in life, I suppose. Not at Cap City though, every time I get something different, it becomes my new favorite dish. The one constant, because I love blue cheese, is their blue cheese salad. It's amazing. At my last visit I got the walleye blue plate special (pictured) and I couldn't have been happier.  Cap City will continue to be one of my go to spots.

We went here to dinner, me, my fiance, my mom and his mom last night. Amanda was such a great server. She was so sweet and helped us make sure we got our leftovers boxed up. We will definitely go back to Cap City again. I highly recommend the carrot cake, thanksgiving day sandwich, the fish or the cheeseburger. And the rolls they give you are delicious! Thanks Amanda!

My party of two wanted a regular table but the wait was over 30 minutes. The hostess said we could sit at the bar overlooking the men getting salads and desserts dinner. We hesitated sitting at this spot but we really enjoyed this seating!  Our server did excellent service with our drinks and food. My order of food had an item that I do not eat. (I mentioned it to the server but it ended up having the ingredient.) The server was very gracious (he was still fairly new) and immediately told the chef. The chef came out and suggested how he could prepare my order which was agreeable to me. The chef was wonderful! Our food was yummy as well at the chocolate cake! We will definitely return to Cap City Fine Diner.

name: The Table
address: 21 E 5th Ave #101, Columbus, OH 43201, USA
reviews: We have eaten at The Table numerous times for dinner and brunch. It has been so amazing each time we have gone from the service to the homemade food! Such creative dishes and such care taken in the preparation. I also have enjoyed their amazing cocktail selection. High recommend!

We went there and got a couple of appetizers and a drink the appetizers were around $12 a piece the drink was also $12 which was approximately 3 to 4 ounces or less the appetizer was perfectly plated  with fresh local ingredients... food was amazing I just can't get over the specialty drink that we got it was gone in about three or four small sips it cost the same as the appetizer 

 if their entrees are as good as the appetizers its worth checking out... definitely need some remodeling... the owner was very nice we will probably stop back and give it another chance

Top Notch!!  The food, oh the food, is amazing...  BUT it’s this FAMILY of owners and staff that make it what it is...  a great experience surround by people who are passionate about what they do and the people they serve!
We love the uniqueness of the menu and  the newness and creativity by their cultured chefs!  
We will definitely be back for more of those melons and ham hocks!!!!  ❤️

I am a foodie and the Table is one of favorite places to dine.  The funky decor, thrift store china, and the amazing east meets west integration.  I am truly happy to be alive to just have enjoyed last night's winter pasta so much.  Of course I was hungry too.  The drinks were fun, the server attentive, the crowd lively but not too much so.   If you're a burger and fries sort, it probably not your place.

I don't spend much time bragging about restaurants, but this one is incredible! I highly recommend experiencing this culinary delight. Ask for Samantha and you will be treated like royalty. I got the impression all of the staff had the same mindset to give their customers the best treatment possible. You won't be disappointed.👌

name: Pasqualone's
address: 5766 Emporium Square, Columbus, OH 43231, USA
reviews: Cant say enough about this place. I had the linguini with clams special and it tasted so fresh and filling. We had so much food, but we didn’t feel miserable and I think that’s a testament to how fresh this food was. Will definitely be back!
Incredible. This is the place you want to go for an authentic Italian meal. Service, food, and ambiance was exactly what I was looking for.
A true dining experience.  Fresh, homemade Italian at its finest. Impeccable service. Go casual or dress up.

This was our 1st time here and it was so good that it won't be our last.  The atmosphere is nice and cozy but, it can be a little loud because it's a small dining room with only about 13 tables. You should call and make a reservation especially on a Friday or Saturday night. The service was excellent! We had our main waiter but there were 2 other guys who help out and the 3 of them worked great together bringing food out, clearing the plates, and making sure our waters were kept full.
Best Italian restaurant in Columbus and it's not even close. Do yourself a service and go.

name: Katalina's in Harrison West
address: 1105 Pennsylvania Ave, Columbus, OH 43201, USA
reviews: This place is a gem! The style and ambience was wonderful! It's fun and eclectic. The food was so delicious!!! I try to eat a lot of vegetarian meals when I can, and this place had a surplus of options and flavors. It was definitely busy and took awhile to get our food, but the wait was worth it. That's what you have to endure sometimes to try the best in town. Will definitely come by again!

We got curb-side delivery to our car. Pancake balls & thick slice bacon, vegan sausage biscuts with eggs for brunch. Also, got their chicken breast sandwich to warm up later for our dinner. Everything is fresh, creative & a good value. Staff is helpful & friendly!

I come here often. In fact I think I actually  live there. The people are friendly.  They've  never met a stranger. The food is yummy! I always pick up an order before going put of town to have for dinner later that night and to have for breakfast the next morning. Plus, I think my husband is so used to me doing it that it's an absolute must.

We recently had breakfast here. Good food! Advertised as locally produced and all natural. Free parking next door from 8:00am to 4:00pm. We noticed after we parked. I had the Southern Brown Betty Biscuit Balls with apple butter for dipping and my wife had the Breakfast Chick 'Wich. Both were delicious! A little more expensive than we thought for a small local restaurant. They sell bottled sodas, water in the box, hot coffee/tea, and varied juices. They are coffee was fresh and tasted like a local coffee house. It was a good find!

I love this little neighborhood joint! My go-to is their pork sandwich, which is big enough to last two meals. The avocado toast is also great - don't let the price deter you! It comes with scrambled, seasoned eggs with queso fresco and roasted seasoned pumpkin seeds. Breakfast taco is equally delicious and filling. The only thing I wouldn't recommend is pancake balls as they were incredibly underwhelming. You're better off with one of savory options instead.

name: Ambrose and Eve
address: 716 S High St, Columbus, OH 43206, USA
reviews: The staff is friendly and attentive. Ruby was super helpful and made our first visit very enjoyable. We had a party of 10 in the private room so we had a little of everything. The food is amazing! Seriously everything I tried was delicious. It feels like a special occasion place without the special occasion price. I’ll be back again very soon.

Truly outstanding fried chicken dinner. The best I have ever had. It is clear that true love and care was put into making this food the best it could be. Tons of food for 2 people. The chicken was the star of the show. It was remarkably crispy and juicy inside and the sides dishes all complemented the chicken well. Absolutely will go back and split this 4 ways with friends

Atmosphere was amazing. Food was top notch. You can tell by the way it tasted and was visually appealing that the person who made the food really cares about what is sent out of the kitchen. I can't wait to go back and try different things. On a side note, I overheard the bartender say that there has yet to be a dish he tried that he did not love.

The space is cute and the service is friendly so that's good. Regarding the food - if you've got a choice between brunch or dinner, then choose brunch. I'd recommend trying the hash browns and the french crepe with simple salad. 
For dinner, "sweet" is very clearly the chefs' forte here and permeates virtually every dish I tried on the menu - from the roasted brussel sprouts to the poached calamari - and the best execution was on the dessert course. While the plating on some of the items were interesting to look at (the calamari, the carrot cake), the overall food experience was missing the mark on providing dimension.

My friend and I came here because we've heard good things about their drinks and food. The place was packed inside, so we were seated outside. It was a very cozy and cute place, from what I saw from the outside looking in. There's various street parking options and many other businesses surrounding the area. Their menus are very pretty and organized pretty well. The prices are a bit expensive and portions are a bit smaller than we expected. Each dish is supposedly enough to share and be family style, but I can tell you, what we ordered for the 2 of us, wasn't enough just for me.
We ended up ordering 2 drinks, an entree, and a shareable dish; braised ribs and brussel sprouts. Our drinks came about 15 minutes after our food, which also took a bit.
The brussel sprouts were very good, but they were crazy special or anything. The ribs on the hand, were delicious! They were Thai inspired and had a unique flavor. However, the portion of the ribs was not worth the price.
We also order the Hydra and Super Bloom cocktails. The Super Bloom was super strong, but the Hydra was pretty refreshing.
This is a cool place to try and it had relaxing and cozy vibes. We enjoyed the atmosphere and our waitress was very nice. I think it's a good place for a casual date or to grab some drinks.

name: Marcella's
address: 615 N High St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: High end pizza/pasta in a casual/classy environment is a great stop for all occasions. Intensive and helpful service, amazing food all around, and though this may be weird to add in a review, very clean and well maintained bathrooms which is much appreciated. All around must try!
I love Marcela's.  The Margharita pizza is so fresh and satisfying.  It's a great deal during hour 4- 6 weekdays.

We were nicely impressed by the place! The restaurant was very busy but very friendly, efficient and accommodating! The atmosphere was warm and friendly! The food was wonderful! Both kids and adults can choose  from the menue! We definitely come to Marcella's again and bring our friends!

I went on Valentine's day and had a reservation for 9:15pm. There was still a wait for reservations when we arrived, but that was expected since it was a holiday and the wait wasn't too long. Our server was very friendly, knowledgeable about the menu, and gave great recommendations. We had the braised veal meatball as an appetizer and it was seriously one of the best things I've ever tasted, I would go back just for that. For my main course I had the eggplant parmesan with a side of spaghetti with marinara sauce. The eggplant and pasta were both cooked perfectly. Also, I recommend the strawberry balsamic cocktail, it is now one of my favorite drinks.

Make sure you reserve a table, especially on the weekends. If you do, you will have a great experience wait. We were there no more than 15 minutes before we are seated and provided service. I was very impressed with the quick service considering how busy it was. The veal meatball was highly recommended as an appetizer and for good reason. The risotto was also very authentic and i don't think it could have been better. I would highly recommend Marcella's for a casual night out, especially with that someone special.

name: Dirty Frank's Hot Dog Palace
address: 248 S 4th St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: This is one of my favorite places in Columbus. Great prices, great selection and atmosphere. Fast and friendly service. They have good gluten free buns too. They turn tables fast and there is frequently a wait. Not the kind of place you go to sit for hours drinking with your friends. Head next door to 16 Bit if you're looking for a place to camp and/or drink.

Best late night place to go to if you want drinks and hot dogs. It's not too expensive and the staff are amazing. I personally recommend the Loaded Potato dog and the Fried Leeks, but there's plenty of options on the menu. They also have vegan friendly options so no one feels left out! Best hot dog place I've ever been to.

Talk about choices! There’s a hot dog for everyone at Dirty Frank’s, even vegans and vegetarians! I had a vegetarian polish sausage fire on the Rhine and a vegetarian sauerkraut dog and they were both excellent. Their fried leeks were also good, not too greasy and cooked just right. 
The only downside is it’s pretty small inside, but take a seat at the bar and have a drink and you won’t even notice.

There is a beauty in finding a restaurant that simultaneously has a great atmosphere, excellent service, a myriad of food and beverage options and a quick ticket time. I can’t say enough great things about this place - most notably their $2 PBR option for happy hour. My favorite dogs are the Chicago and the Princess but I try to switch it up often. 

Whether you sit at the bar or one of the tables, you’ll be in the presence of great company and receiving excellent service. This place sets the bar very high!

Best cheap eats in Columbus (they've literally won this title from magazines). I'm usually not a big hot dog person, but this place is amazing. The sheer variety alone is enough to satisfy the pickiest of eaters. You'll find the strangest of unexpectedly good combinations. Last time I went, I tried a dog with pretzel bites on it! Their Mac and cheese is also surprisingly delicious. Love this place.

name: Hot Chicken Takeover
address: 59 Spruce St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: Hard to say anything more about this place than the 1000 of other reviews.  It is just great chicken.  If I live closer I could probably eat here 4 times a week.  I love the common tables as you can always strike up a random conversation if you want to.  With the location in the North Market it gives you a few other places to stop for desert on the way out.

DELICIOUS CHICKEN! Also really enjoyed the Mac and Cheese as well. The line was long (waited for the better part of an hour), but other than that, i have no complaints. Would recommend it to just about anyone who would want my opinion.
Awesome hot chicken & so much food for under $15. Really cool that the tea is always free!

Love this place. The service is always friendly and the people make the experience worth the wait. I enjoy that they have a chart on the wall to tell you what they are "All Out" of, so your aren't too disappointed when you make it to the register.

First timers.  I went with the HOT.  The dark was sold out so I went with boneless chicken breast.  I did double Mac sides (mistake).  First off, the chicken is delicious.  I was worried because white meat can be dry, not this chicken.  And yes, it was hot.  I drank A LOT of iced tea.  The Mac and cheese was a bit gritty.  Flavor was okay, but I don’t like grit.  The coleslaw ( which I had some of my friends) is more vinegary than mayonnaise-y....and I am okay with that.  Definitely, going back.  Five stars for the chicken.  What took it to 4 was that Mac n cheese.

name: BRAVO Cucina Italiana
address: 1803 Olentangy River Rd, Columbus, OH 43212, USA
reviews:
Today was my very first visit to the Bravo location on Olentangy River Road. My mentor and I stopped in to grab a quick meal while waiting for traffic to clear up in the area. The setting in the restaurant was traditional and set the tone for the meal. We were seated quickly by the waitress after being offered a booth or a table. The waitress (Devin) was kind and knowledgeable, which is always greatly appreciated. The appetizers arrived to the table quickly, which was a surprise considering the number of tables our waitress had to attend to. The entrees came quickly and without erroror or complaint.

All in all it was a positive experience!

Will return again in the future.

Overall, this restaurant is wonderful. Servers are professional. This can be a nicer restaurant for a date, but it can also be good for the occasional casual family outing. Kids can have fun too - usually they'll role out some paper for them to draw on, and (at least historically) they can bring out some dough for them to play with.

So far the only dish I haven't approved of is the stuffed french toast from their brunch menu. Although it's delicious, I don't think 3 bread slices (halved) is worth $9.

My husband and I have been to this restaurant several times and have always been pleased with the service and the food here.  But last night, as full and busy as they were. I felt they truly excelled themselves!   It was extremely busy, being not only a Saturday night, but the night preceding the big Superbowl game! We watched the waiters coming and going in a very efficient but friendly way, and the whole atmosphere was one of congeniality and expertise.  We were both amazed to witness how well everything was being managed in such a friendly and caring way. And it goes without saying really, the food was excellent. A night to remember! Bravo! to Bravo!

Overall great food, the staff tries their best to be amazing but  sometimes when there's a ton and I mean a ton of people on a weekend let's say they're a little run thin. Last time there with the place packed, a few things I asked for never ever made it to the table. Even after 3-4 reminders. But if you catch this place not too busy, it's basically 5 stars. The food is really killer, I recommend the pork chop plate.
This is some of the best Italian food I have had in a very long time. The flavor was over the top. Highly suggest it!

name: Veritas
address: 11 W Gay St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews:
Veritas is as the name states the truth of cuisine.  Each dish is masterfully crafted and every element tended to as if it was its own dish. 
When you go truly allow yourself to embrace the magic of the cuisine and taste every element of the dish.  To rush through a course is only cheating yourself of a blissful delight.
The staff is great and highly attentive. The level of service here is one not often seen these days as they embrace the passion of the experience with you and make each dish come to life.
The wine pairings are also well thought out and accent each dish to perfection. If you are not a wine person or do not drink at all, do not fret as they have a wide array of other options.

Treat yourself and someone else to a devine experience by checking out Veritas.

The Whitaker Review
