Incredible cuisine. That’s the word for it. Bigger than just food. Looks and tastes great. Amazing wine list. Be sure to do a pairing while you visit.

While the food/pairings were amazing, I felt that my meal was a little rushed,  especially since there were only 3 other tables in use when we got there. No sooner than we finished one course, then the next one was being served. They even tried to take my desert away before I was done. 

Again - food was phenomenal.

Veritas is the best restaurant in central ohio and it’s not even close. The attention to detail and unique combinations create a superb dining experience. Meal aside, bar and tender rival any of the hottest spots in NYC. There will be a changing of the guard at the bar in the fall, get there before he heads west. Cheers!

The overall experience was enjoyable with the majority of the tasting items interesting and quite tasty although everything was served cold or room temperature. The steak was on the menu as fillet but was far from it. The texture and lack of tenderness was more like a sirloin. Wine was pricey with very small pours.  The timing of the dishes was off with a hurried feeling to eat and a lot of down time in between. Staff knowledge and attention were very good.

name: Bonifacio
address: 1577 King Ave, Columbus, OH 43212, USA
reviews: If you're craving for Filipino food or have never tried it, I highly recommend this place. At first I was doubtful because it was modern Filipino, but all the dishes still reminded me a little bit of home! With a modern twist. I was surprised, but enjoyed it immensely.

We went there on a Thursday night which was a Boodle Night. The food was amazing. To be authentic, you have to eat with your hands but utensils are available, too. Some of the menu cocktails were on the sweeter end of the spectrum but overall they were good and the service was excellent and the bartender was really nice. 
They do have a special menu in which it shows all GF and vegan/vegetarian options, there are quite a few picks, so I encourage vegan/vegetarians to go there as well. Personally I wish there were more of those options though. 
On Friday nights, if I’m not wrong, they have Manila nights with a DJ and music after 10 pm until 1 am. 
Highly recommended, will go back.
Delicious food. Intended for leisurely dining. Slow down and enjoy the conversations around you

All the food was delicious. The service was excellent (minus one lil issue) and the experience was great. My only complaint was that I asked the server about the dish I was ordering, to get clarification on what it was and it was not as described at all how it actually was. FYI the mung beans is not like a green bean, which is the dish I'm referring to that I asked  the server about. Luckily, I had an open mind and it was still delicious but I wish he would have clarified what I was getting with the kitchen if he didn't know what it was either, he could have said I'm not sure lemme check. It tastes a lot like black eyed peas.

I visit this great spot many times a year! This is my favorite place to to have a good dinner.  I visit this place routinely. The cooking is excellent, the team is courteous and the rates are affordable. I enjoy being in this restaurant for a nice dinner.

name: The Eagle Short North Temporarily Closed
address: 790 N High St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: Legendary and award winning fried chicken? Not really sure about what. It’s a cool spot, really open dining room with a big bar, good local taps. But i came for the fried chicken. When I think of fried chicken I think of that super crispy crust, not what I got, yea it’s crisp and plenty of flavor. But where’s the texture! The price is pretty good for that location. The hot chicken takeover in the market is a better bet for fried chicken in the area in my opinion.

Even though it was a busy Saturday night, we were still seated within 15 minutes. They offer family style seating here, so be prepared to sit in a booth with another party. With that being said, you will have more than enough room to yourself. They have a nice selection of beer and you can’t go wrong with fried chicken! The BLT was filling and tasty. The Mac n cheese is to die for! If you’re looking for a fun place to scratch your fried chicken itch, this is definitely a great option though the parking situation isn’t ideal but that’s to be expected in the short north!

I devoured a Sumptuous and succulent chicken sandwich with a delectable side of spoon bread. Once finished I proceeded to wash the meal down with a thirst quenching stout. Please do yourself a favor and stop by for a meal, it’s worth its weight in gold.

The Eagle is some of the best food in the Short North. High end southern food with a great beer selection. They have larger communal seating or seating at the large bar. The ambiance of the bar is very nice and the place is clean. My chicken was cooked perfectly and my mac n' cheese was outstanding.
Awesome place with fantastic food! Delicious and the service is incredible. Couldn't be more happy.

name: Cooper's Hawk Winery & Restaurant
address: 4230 The Strand, Columbus, OH 43219, USA
reviews: So delicious went here to celebrate my best friend's birthday! I got the jambalaya and it was very very good! My best friend is member and she goes all the time she's had a few things that are good. I love love the sweet red wine its my favorite.  Before I tried this wine I hated wine but this wine is delicious! The service was great as well the people are so personal and friendly. Great place to eat, drink and have a nice time.

Overall great experience. The food was delicious. Everyone talks about the brussel sprouts, and for good reason, it's very good. Highly recommended. Also the cheese plate is a great way to pair some food with a wine sampler. The entree's were very good. Your take away should be the service!  Sam was fun, and had great passion for all things food and wine.  He was informative and not pretentious. Cooper's Hawk does a nice job on capturing wine flavor profiles in easy to understand descriptions.  I will be back. If you're on the fence, get off it and go. So much fun!
Service was impeccable. Food and wine was delicious. The only downside was the Nashville hot chicken was not very spicy - at all.

We were in town for business and decided to have a nice evening.   We had made reservations a day in advance and after an exhausting day was looking to relax with friends and good conversation.   After about a 1/2 hour wait, which wasn't out of the ordinary, we were seated upstairs next to the check out register.   Due to an injury, I clearly have an issue with stairs, and never once did our hostess offer an elevator.  In fact, after climbing 20 steps, yeah for me!!!, I noticed the elevator in the back, and commented on that, and she replied "oh we could have use that." My response: "That information would have been helpful at the bottom of the stairs."  Onto order, our waiter Devan, who was clearly more concerned about his birthday party of 8 people that our table, left us in the dirt.  After finally, grabbing the arm of one of the other waiters, who subsequently received our gratuities, tirelessly waited our table and well as many of the others, while Devan, concentrated on "his" 8 people.  My meal was wonderful, however, my friends who ordered the surf and turf decided that the seafood had a extremely fishy taste,  unlike crab cakes and scallops.  Would I recommend this to friends, very unlikely. I was extremely embarrassed to have taken my friends here.

This place was amazing. All their food os made fresh in house. The service was perfect. She was attentive and helpful. She answered all of our questions. The food was amazing, fresh, and flavorful. It is pricey, but well worth it.

name: HangOverEasy
address: 1646 Neil Ave, Columbus, OH 43201, USA
reviews: Great breakfast and really reasonable prices. Normally a long wait during Saturday football game days but worth every second. Staff is super friendly and quick on service. Food and drinks were top notch! Definitely recommend going if you have the chance

We came here because we've heard good things and reviews. It was pretty busy this day and parking was a bit hard. We were seated at the bar, which was fine. We got one of the skillets and the Reuben sandwich.
The Reuben was pretty greasy and the bread was a bit soggy. The meat wasn't very flavorful and not filling. The sausage skillet was lacking a lot of flavor and seasoning. We were a bit disappointed in our food. I love breakfast foods because it usually is made good and isn't complicated, so I was surprised at how disappointed I was.
I thought services was decent, but it seemed like everyone was busy and didn't care to stop and check the bar area.
There's a decent amount of space to sit, parking is usually garage or street, and there's no WiFi that we noticed.
The atmosphere and area is really nice and chill, so I did like the environment.

Very cool little brunch place. Reasonably priced food and drinks. My order of corned beef hash was the perfect portion and it was impressively good. I always have low expectations for corned beef hash from a restaurant, and I think this was better than homemade. Very impressed!!!

Food far better than many seemingly-similar places. Creative, well-prepared and just plain yummy. Highly recommend Chicken Chorizo Skillet and Whole Lotta Goodness. Also, breakfast should always come with the option for dessert, so I recommend checking out their seasonal pancakes. Always fun, always delicious.

Even on a busy Saturday morning, my friends and I were able to be squeezed in.  While a bit loud and busy, we understood because of the usual breakfast and brunch rush to a popular campus spot.  Service was good, with food coming out relatively quick.  Everyone at our table had a great meal, with a good choice on the menu for most people.  I had the Pork Belly Benedict, which was cooked perfectly.  I would absolutely return, and recommend it to anyone and everyone looking for a fun breakfast spot near campus and the med center.

name: Kooma sushi Restaurant
address: 37 Vine St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: Got 4 different sushi rolls and I'm not able to take any home because it's all been eaten, very delicious and quick service.  Smaller setting and yet absolutely perfect to be a sushi bar would 100% come back! Note: had the 007, buckeye, san Fran, and misty rolls!

My favorite sushi hidden gem! Limited hours which is great. Staff is awesome everytime I've been. I think Hadley was the name of my waitress and she is absolutely beautiful and very personable. She spent a large amount of time helping me try to find my favorite. The miso is a must have! I very rarely give a 5 star rating but this is well deserved. Can't wait until I'm back in the area for lunch...

Kooma sushi is always consistent. The lunch box has a variety of some of the best dishes Kooma offers.  It is filling and a great value for the amount of food.  Substitute the California roll for any roll of your choice to spice things up (upcharge applies).
One of the best sushi spots in town, and not terribly expensive. Can't wait to go back!

I eat here quite a bit as it's near work. The lunchbox is a great portion but generally a few drawbacks... 1, the place smells bad. I know its sushi, but it's really bad all the time. 2, quite a few times my chicken teriyaki has been inedible rubber in the lunchbox. It happens enough that it's clearly something to do with how they're keeping it. Still a decent place for lunch..

name: Buca di Beppo Italian Restaurant
address: 343 N Front St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: This is the first time me and my wife have been. This place is amazing! Food was excellent and the staff were on point. I would definitely recommend this place to all my friends. Portions were huge and we had to get to go containers. Next time I will bring an extra person to help eat all the food. I will definitely be back! Thank you all for a wonderful experience!

This place is a amazing place to eat and have an all around great time. The servers are nice and treat you as if you were family. They all work together to make sure everyone is happy. The food is timed so you don't get everything all at once. Speaking of the food, it is DELIGHTFUL! Perfectly cooked pasta with just the right amount of seasoning. You gotta remember the portions are huge so order carefully or clear out some room in the fridge for leftovers!

(Bad)No soup ,(fad)Best fettuccine ever , (overpriced) ,$20  small bowl mac n cheese bites.we wanted reg. mac n cheese not bites. The birthday dessert was  (Spectacular) the brownie sundaes. the good the bad and the  ugly. Will go back for fettuccine  for sure. Hope it is the same. What Italian restaurant does not have wedding soup. Or any soup all the time.

Hot food was cold upon arrival. Salad was wilted and warm with lettuce hearts in the mix. One dressing for a family salad. Chicken Parm was soggy. Garlic bread was underdone. And one of the cake slices was missing. I would love a refund or an attemp for them to make this right.

Definitely worth it! Tonight was our first time dinning there.  We felt like family. We had an amazing server (Dottie) The food was over the top delicious! We recommend everyone give it a try.  You won't be disappointed!

name: Service Bar
address: 1230 Courtland Ave, Columbus, OH 43201, USA
reviews: Our party of four arrived around 7pm on a Friday night and was seated immediately because we made reservations.  The restaurant was at about 90% capacity at that time.  The ambiance was a modern 1920’s vibe, there was a lot of attention to these details in their clean restrooms (especially soap dispenser).  The spirits were plentiful and the bar was sprawling.  I came here for the culinary infusion foods and the presentation of it.  We ordered the smaller plates as starters, it was the pork grinds and the mussels; which were both delicious, they had a great technique to create pork grinds as well as they did.  About 25 minutes later, our main course arrived.  We ordered the whole chicken, which came out to our surprise half roasted chicken and topped with the other half with fried chicken, and then topped with naan bread.  Reading from the menu, I visualized a whole roasted-red tandoori chicken.  The fried chicken was fresh and had a good light batter coating it, but was overly salted.  We finished the meal with the cheesecake which wasn’t overly sweet and a good way to finish.  Overall, we spent about $325 for the course and experience.  I’ve come to realize my love and appreciation for simple street food.

Fabulous from start to finish. Dumplings in their sauce were delicious, the duck was the best I've ever had, and the desserts were amazing. Decadent, rich, so tasty. Love that they have a whole vegetarian menu. The Ross (a kind of Reuben style sandwich) was also very very yummy. Would go back anytime. Decor is classy, beautiful natural light.
The cocktails here are insanely delicious! And the food always takes us by surprise. Can't recommend Service Bar enough.
Drinks are super tasty!   Mocktails are dope too.  The food tho!  Try the brisket tacos and Szechuan dumplings 🥟.

The food and service was great.  We had dinner after taking the distillery tour (and buying a lot of spirits!). 

Two stars for two reasons:  the host told me twice that they were booked until 9pm and couldn't seat us (I then used OpenTable to book a reservation for 15 minutes later).  And, my dinner consisted solely of 7 small (rabbit filled) tortellini for $25..   I left still 
hungry!  My fault for not ordering something else.

name: Dempsey's Food & Spirits
address: 346 S High St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: I was craving pub food and wanted somewhere I'd not been before. Google suggested Dempsey's and I was so happy I tried it. It was delocious and perfect.

This hidden gem has tons of charm. The bar itself has a story and just creates a fun atmosphere. The walls are lined with Columbus nostalgic photos. The menu was filled with a great variety of Irish classics and local favorites. The service was wonderful too! Parking was a challenge but worth it!

The comfortable little gem is tucked away in the downtown area of Columbus, right around the corner from the Southern Theater. It's beautiful inside and not what you expect looking outside in. 

The service was ok. It was a very busy night when I went in and only two tables were open. The staff seemed to be overwhelmed with the response of the game that was playing. They looked checked out and ready to go. The waitress didn't really check in on us and brought us our bill without us asking or her asking if we needed anything else. 

The food was great. The buffalo chicken wrap tasted great. The crab cakes we're delicious. Their menu is quite large so I am excited to try this place again even if it's delivery or carry out.

Had breakfast Today before doing my civic duty as a juror and ate an excellent  breakfast. The cubed potatoes with rosemary alongside the crispy bacon and fluffy scrambled eggs made start of the morning appealing. Thank you so much.
Popular local. Genuine Irish hospitality in downtown Columbus. The bar and surrounds are some of the oldest parts of the city. The food and drink is wonderful. Enjoy.

name: Bangkok Grocery & Restaurant
address: 3277 Refugee Rd, Columbus, OH 43232, USA
reviews:
They don’t have fountain drinks in this place but they have true Thai food. Spring rolls are always the best. Good Pad See Eww. 
Many spices come to the table so you can adjust the heat as hot as you like.
It’s very quiet and dim. Service is fast! So this makes a great lunch spot.

This is a great hidden gem. The best Thai food I've had in Columbus and the prices are cheap! You get so much bang for your buck. It's a small restaurant, very casual. There are lots of pictures on the menu which make it easy to try something new. The servers are very nice. There are two entrances because there's a grocery store one one side. Make sure you go to the right door.
I always enjoy going to Bangkok. Bic is so sweet and wonderful. I love that lady. Her sweetness makes the food all that much better! So handy that the grocery store is connected to the restaurant

The facilities and location are a little run down, but the staff and food are great.  Best authentic Thai food in central Ohio. Having the grocery store next door is a plus.  The Som Tam is just like Bangkok! Highly recommended!

Some of the best Thai in Columbus and a great grocery store for those looking to cook with authentic ingredients from the region. Every dish I have had is great and the prices / portions are very appropriate. I would not hesitate to bring friends along on a trip to eat here!

name: Smoked On High BBQ
address: 755 S High St, Columbus, OH 43206, USA
reviews: This place has amazing food!  My husband got our Easter dinner from here and I wasn’t disappointed one bit.  We had the drum sticks, mac n cheese, coleslaw, and cornbread.  All of it is amazing.  Can’t wait to try the rest of the menu.  Keep up the good work.

I try to reserve 5 stars for very special occasions.  So not to say this doesn't necessarily warrant 5 stars, like most other reviews have given it, just putting my review into context.  When it comes to BBQ in the greater Columbus area, in my opinion it's between this place and Ray Ray's Hog Pit.  The venue is a converted Victorian style (?) home so seating in the colder months can be very limited.  During the warmer months seating outside adds to the capacity.  I would suggest for the first visit to get the sampler platter (pictured) which has a little of everything.  This is plenty of food and will allow you to taste it all and maybe decide your favorite(s) for future orders.  If you're in the area, definitely a place you should visit.  Make sure you try the "Max N' Cheese" if you're seeking a spiritual experience.

Top notch BBQ. The Brisket was top notch not certain if I have ever had better. Great smoke and tenderness. Flavor out of this world. The greens were also incredible you are doing yourself a disservice if you don’t try them. The Pork was also great easily on par with anything I’ve had in North Carolina aka the home of Pulled Pork. Don’t sleep on the smoke drumsticks either. Overall everything thing I had there was great if you are in Columbus and like BBQ and haven’t ate there then go right now. 10/10

Great BBQ for an awesome price. We didn't know what to order so Anna and Alex helped us out with some options to get a meal for 2 of us situated. They were very friendly and helpful. We got 2 meals and a meat only option and there was more food than 2 of us could finish. Everything was fantastic and the sides were great. We ordered the brisket, pork, and sausage for the meats and had cornbread, coleslaw, and Max n cheese for the side. Great flavor for everything and the Victorian house converted restaurant was really cool. They also have outdoor seating if you want. Would highly recommend and would definitely return again.

My husband and I had the ribs from this place twice now.  The ribs are great! They are by far the best ribs in Columbus.  Very meaty with a great smoked taste.  Highly recommended!
We did takeout both times, so can't really comment on inside service. When we arrived both times the ribs were waiting on us for takeout - no wait time!

name: Buckeye Chili & Smokehouse
address: 30 S Young St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: As someone who works about 100 yards from this place, I am very disappointed that I found it because I will be spending all my money on lunch here! I decided to give it a try as it's a new restaurant and I do love BBQ and I was not disappointed. The people working there were all very friendly, and my order was up in a timely manner. I ordered just the pulled pork and cornbread with a side of Mac & Cheese. The food was fantastic. The pulled pork was one of the best pulled pork I've ever had, and I've eaten quite a bit. The mac & cheese was delicious as well, very creamy and not grainy like it can be sometime. Even the cornbread was warm and moist. If I had one complaint it would be that I wanted more! Will be back to try the wings and the brisket real soon! Do yourself a favor and go here, it's a nice change from the multitude of sandwich shops downtown.

Diamond in the rough.
This new restaurant/ bar sits tucked away in off broad Street. You won't want to pass this up. They have a full bar for cocktails, wine and beer. The food ,I had today was really good. I had the chili spaghetti. I ate whole dish. It comes with garlic toast which is a great bonus. The flavor profile of the chili was very good and well thought out. It had just enough kick to it to compliment the spaghetti which was topped with cheese. They told me you can get the chili spicy if I wanted but this was perfect. Stop by to beat the rush hour traffic and have some great food ..
Food was amazing. Great staff. And what a wonderful change of pace from "downtown" dinning.  Definitely one of my new favorites.

This is Real Stick to your Ribs, gonna need to unbutton your pants. Someone one Stop me! It's so Good, BBQ!!
Really cool older building with unique features! Gotta say the view of downtown Columbus is really on display through out the dining area!
Can't wait to go back before everyone else discovers this hidden gem!

Excellent service and excellent meal. I had a cup of regular chili to start and the brisket/cornbread for my lunch meal. Everything was wonderful. I know where I'll be going for barbecue when I'm downtown! I can't recommend this place enough!

name: Condado Tacos
address: 132 S High St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: I have to say that these are the best tacos in Columbus Ohio. They have half off margaritas during happy hours. And an option to make your own tacos or to choose from a predetermined list. The place has a hip artwork around. Our waiters were also helpful and cheery. Would recommend. An absolute 5 star experience.

Great inexpensive option to eat. The decor is fun, and the staff are welcoming and friendly. The food is good, with plenty of options for customizing your tacos. Happy hour is 4 to 7 and tacos are 1 dollar off. Margaritas were half off. Good quality drink.

I can't say enough good things about this place! A real gem downtown offering fantastic tacos of which the build your own option is very well done. Their menu is labeled appropriately for dietary needs, and who can go wrong with flights of margaritas!? All that and I haven't even mentioned the great atmosphere. I really enjoyed the outdoor patio area!

I ate at Condado Tacos Commons earlier this year [6-26-2019] while on my way to a discussion meeting at the Main Branch of the Columbus Metropolitan Library.

The main product of Condado Tacos, as one might imagine from their name, is tacos. There are many choices and combinations of ingredients. Customers place their orders by filling in circles on pieces of paper that resemble absentee ballots. Up to two different flavors of tacos [of any quantity] may be ordered on the same piece of paper.

I had previously eaten at a different Condado Tacos [2977 N. High St.] so I had already learned how to order tacos at Condado Tacos. My carefully-ordered tacos arrived quickly, had been made to order, and had been absolutely delicious.
Wow. Pleasant surprise. Place was totally packed but we had good quick service and was seated quickly. The food was delicious, probably our favorite of all similar chains. Will be returning!

name: Black Point
address: 570 N High St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: I loved it! Very classy but also encompasses a trendy, inviting neighborhood (Short North) vibe. Delicious steak & seafood offering but plenty for the vegan to enjoy as well. I visited as a group but it could be romantic also. Thank U for an entirely enjoyable evening b4 the game!

Let’s start with the filet mignon it was absolutely insanely delicious. Cooked to perfection. The sides are top notch as well. Friends we went with tried lobster for the first time and they loved it. The service was exceptional. To top it off the salted Carmel cheesecake was out of this world.

Great evening at Black Point celebrating my birthday! Awesome service, fabulous food, loved the lobster crab cake and my bison steak! Family style sides and the flourless chocolate torte as delicious as well! We will be back and it is one of my new favorite restaurants.

The food was great, the service not so much. I went on a Wednesday, we were seated at the other dining room on the right  which only had 3 tables including mine(and a group of loud people in the party room behind me ). Out of the first 3 cocktails we ordered from their main cocktail menu , 2 of them they were out of the ingredients to make, which shouldn't happen if you put those drinks on the front page. I finished my drink before the entree came but was never asked if I wanted a second one. Our desserts came without forks or spoons and we had to flag someone down to get us forks....
Steak and dessert were awesome though.
Omg great time awesome experience, our server was great and fun!!! We went during restaurant week it was still a great time

name: J. Alexander's - Redlands Grill
address: 7550 Vantage Dr, Columbus, OH 43235, USA
reviews: Had the rotisserie chicken. It was amazing, tender and flavorful! The smashed potatoes, salad and croissants we delightful too! Service is always great, fast and friendly. The servers are knowledgeable and fun. Top plates for me: Rotisserie Chicken, Rattlesnake Pasta, Steak Maui. My wife adores the chocolate cake with ice cream!
Our waitress wasn’t the best this time around but overall still a great experience. Food is always good and the atmosphere is relaxed and quiet. The Mac and cheese is really good give it a shot.

The smell of wood fired steaks hits you as soon as you open the front doors! Great steaks and sides with a friendly staff that’s helpful and fast. Lunch menu is slightly different with smaller meal options for a little less money.

Went there two nights in a row for their prime rib which is excellent. The BEST! Eva recommend the crab cakes...best I ever had including on the East Coast. "Trust me", she said. Wait staff are great, making us roadies feel at home for the past 8 weeks. What's more, they carry my scotch, not available in most restaurants.  We three go here at least twice per week. Disturbing news that the Governor has closed all restaurants and bars in Ohio today.
Excellent food, steak grilled to a perfect medium rare.  Rachel gave the best service we've ever had.  And we've had some very good service.  If I could rate this higher, I would.

name: Yats Grandview
address: 1386 Grandview Ave, Columbus, OH 43212, USA
reviews: Wonderful Cajun style food with right amount of Spices enough to fill your Taste buds. NOLA themed Restaurant will sure remind you of that NOLA style food, if u had tasted it earlier anywhere. You can ask for multiple samples before you can make your orders as everything comes on a Bed of Rice and Cajun spices dripped French Bread. Plenty of Parking space in the Lot opposite to it.

Great food, good portions and reasonably priced! Appreciate that carry-out is still open, love to support local! 

Young lady at the front counter was EXTREMELY rude, but given working through pandemic you never know what you’re going to get.

Great food, very quick service. The highlight is that the food is quite homely, and doesn't taste like it's made by some fast food joint. The variety of sauces and seasoning options are also great. The option to mix and match dishes and main course is also worth trying. Recommended for lunch and dinner.

My new favorite place in Columbus.  The food is amazing! Start with the drunken chicken and work your way down the menu.  The Cajun flavors are incredible.  Just go ahead and ask for an extra helping of bread, yes it’s that good.  I always get a couple extra to share with coworkers.

Never had creole food before until I had Yats. Not only is it full of flavor, but a full plate. The will drench a bed of rice in any entree you order. The chorizo and drunken chicken are my favorite! I wish I could remember the name of the little desserts because those were the best! And that's just the food. The customer service is great and all the staff are the sweetest people. I can't wait to order from them again

name: Jeff Ruby's Steakhouse, Columbus
address: 89 E Nationwide Blvd, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews:
Oh, my... What a wonderful dining experience! Our table was ready when we arrived. The service was attentive without being pushy. The food was perfect. I had the NY strip, medium rare. My date had the baked lobster tail. We shared sides if crispy French fries and green beans with garlic. A bottle of Super Tuscan wine accompanied everything. 

While we dined under crystal chandeliers, a flash flood filled the streets, turning them into an impassible lake. After our meal, we toured the rest of the restaurant and were allowed to leave through a back door into an alley that was in higher, drier ground. 

What a night!

Awesome place! Beautiful restaurant, waitress were very helpful and very friendly. Everything was really good, my son and daughter n law took me out for my birthday and I loved it. Very special! Thanks Aaron and Nora! Had a great time!

Absolutely amazing. The food was impeccable and the staff was incredibly engaging and courteous. The atmosphere was different in a great way. My wife and I had an unforgettable 5 year anniversary. Make sure your wallet is ready as this is a top tier steak house but it is worth every penny.

Best place I have ever been. The staff was extremely personable a d easy to talk to. The chef came out to ask how was my salmon (it was the best salmon I have ever had *single tear falls from eye*). He sat with us for a while and we talked about his ink and how he loves cooking (his name was Tom). Awesome evening.

This place never fails to impress. Beautiful decor, amazing ambience, and excellent customer service. Perfect for a date. The food is delicious! Not ready to drop $50+ on just a slab of meat? Jeff Ruby's offer specials throughout the year!

name: Northstar Cafe in the Short North
address: 951 N High St, Columbus, OH 43201, USA
reviews: We stopped in for breakfast. There is a patio, but we sat inside. You go up and order at the counter, but they bring you your meal. The coffee was very good. I had fresh squeezed orange juice, WOW!! My wife had a blueberry smoothie, WOW again!! Our food was amazing, eggs were perfect and the sausage was delicious. Adding to this delightful meal was the biscuits, soft and fluffy and the jelly that came with them was the best I've ever tasted. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone, and I really hope to stop again soon!!

I love coming to Northstar! All the staff here are friendly and make me feel happy whenever I step in there - the vibe is contagious! It's a bright, airy space and is a mix between quick-service and table service. The food is executed consistently and they are very accomodating if you need modifications (and will suggest the right mods to fit your needs). I love that I can get local beers here, as well. Come here by yourself or with friends to enjoy their patio in the spring/summer as well.

The store is very clean and the staff is incredibly friendly. All of the food is organic and local(when available), they have multiple vegetarian and vegan options. Northstar Burger is my favorite veggie burger around. A little pricey, but I'm always willing to pay a little more for a local company that provides clean food. Will definitely be back.
Fresh varieties of local goodies! Vegan and vegetarian options are plentiful. The local cafe can be very busy, with good reason. Even when there is a line out the door, it's worth the wait!
Everything is always so phenomenal! April was amazing in every aspect! This is now my favorite location 💜

name: Due Amici
address: 67 E Gay St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews:
My wife and I had our rehearsal dinner here the night before our wedding in March of 2020 and LOVED it. The staff were beyond amazing, the space was terrific (we had the private room on the side), the food was delicious, and planning was easy and simple. Our rehearsal dinner was 40 people and everyone fit perfectly. 

Special shout out to Lexie and MaryCatherine for their help!
Great place for a romantic date! Went for Valentine's day and the atmosphere was romantic. Rose petals on the floor and table was a nice touch. Food was delicious and flavorful!
Trendy Italian restaurant and bar in downtown Columbus. Cool decor. The bathrooms seem like they're in a basement dungeon but the entrance decors are still cool.
Awesome service, cocktails, and food.  Nice mix of trandy/new and traditional dishes on the menu.  Highly recommend trying a pasta dish.  Wasn't busy on a Wed night.  Walked right in...
Great atmosphere and ambiance.  Food was great at a reasonable price.  First time there on Valentine's Day and plan to go back again!

name: Tony's
address: 16 W Beck St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews:
A wonderful restaurant! This was my second time and everything is delicious and the service is wonderful! Kyle was out server and he's great! I recommend the Roman bread for an appetizer especially if you like blue cheese. The 
Veal Saltimbocca is mouth watering good. Tony's Own fettuccine put me outside my comfort zone. It's a seafood pasta with a cream sauce. That to was very good and I would have both again. My friends all had different items. They all taste good. I posted a picture of my first cosmopolitan. Go to Tony's and enjoy some real Italian food!
This place was amazing! The wedding soup tasted just like my grandma's from Italy. Everything was delicious,  we will be back and probably frequently.
Love Tony’s ! Never had a bad meal there. The chicken liver appetizer is the best ever! Highly recommend it!
Met Tony tonight. Super nice. I had a great time. The food and atmosphere was awesome. Great to patronize a locally owned establishment like Tony's.

We was so disappointed after reading the reviews. We had the meatballs and spaghetti and meatloaf. The meatballs and meatloaf taste the same very mushy and had absolutely no flavor. The marinara sauce on the meatballs did not have the nice tomato flavor that you would expect from a true Italian restaurant. The spaghetti sauce was just as Bland.

name: Strongwater Food and Spirits
address: 401 W Town St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: We showed up for happy hour. The ambience was good and staff were okay. The food was really good. We got the Tennessee chicken which was very spicy in a great way! We also got the mushroom risotto which was really rich and good. Highly recommend. The dessert was very underwhelming though. It was essentially chocolate in a cup that felt more like chocolate pudding. Still recommend this place and will go back.

Strongwater is one of the few sit down restaurants in the area but it's one of the best visually. Beautifully decorated with the well maintained vintage factory character. The lighting is great in dark evenings for a nice romantic date night or even just a chill place for drinks with some friends.

Speak of drinks- craft cocktails here are amazing. Over the years of coming here, their cocktails hold a high standards, with premium ingredients and well blended. My most recent visit, they unfortunately were out of a few ingredients and couldn't make what my friend ordered. She chose something else and enjoyed it. Excellent quality overall.

Although I have had their food a couple of times, I cannot recollect my experience eating here entirely. The menu is a bit eclectic and I remember the food being of great quality. However, it's not a menu that pulls me in. 

The staff has always been great.

Regardless of my taste of the menu, I often recommend Strongwater and people generally enjoy it. If not anything other than a cocktail.

Service was excellent, Erika took incredible care of us as well as suggested some unique dishes with their watermelon gazpacho! 
Seriously some of the best french fries I have ever tasted and the breakfast sandwich totally hit the spot!

I recently [10-24-2019] attended the 2019 "Gift To Be Simple" fundraiser for the Simply Living community organization at Strongwater Food and Spirits.

Previously [1-27-2016 and 2-2-2017], I had attended two "Allies for Equality" receptions, sponsored by Equality Ohio, at that same location [though not necessarily in the same room].

Strongwater Food and Spirits is a great space and definitely has plenty of room.

I had been somewhat confused when first arriving for my most recent event at Strongwater Food and Spirits because I had arrived at what I had assumed to be the "main entrance" for my event [based on the "401 W. Town St." address that I had been given].

My event had actually been in the Strongwater Event Space rather than Strongwater Food and Spirits so I was directed to walk through several intervening areas to reach the actual location of the event, the Strongwater Event Space [on the west side of the building that faces Lucas St.].

I now know that there is also an entrance to the Strongwater Event Space that is directly off of Lucas St.

Strongwater has the BEST fries hands down. All the servers are really friendly. I had a black bean burger and got the appetizer that's like a fried risotto (can't remember the name) so delicious. Great drinks too! It's a little expensive but the food  and service is awesome

name: Happy Greek Restaurant and Pub
address: 660 N High St, Columbus, OH 43215, USA
reviews: Absolutely love this place. It was my first time and my s/o insisted on the flaming cheese. Even though we were about to go into a lock down, the energy was calm and comforting. Service was friendly and the food was amazing. We will become regulars via takeout for now but I cannot wait for all of this to be over so i can go in again!

Dinner was delicious and genuinely Greek. Vegetarian dolmadas - vine leaves stuffed with spicy rice in a lemon garlic sauce plus a salad, left enough room for dessert.
Not a wheelchair accessible venue at all. Stairs to enter and very narrow. They do however do take away.

Got take out yesterday.  The fried smelts were awesome and the dolmades with meat very satisfying.  Will definitely go back for the full experience once restaurants are allowed to seat customers again!
Great Greek food and nice atmosphere. It’s a happy place to dine!

I’ve been here multiple times now. For some reason every time I’ve gone it’s always almost empty. I never understood why I think their food is amazing and the staff is always really great. If you like Greek food I highly recommend checking Happy Greek out. Greek  lasagna is fireeee! Enjoy!

name: BJ's Restaurant & Brewhouse
address: 4020 Stelzer Rd, Columbus, OH 43219, USA
reviews: This place is a favorite among my entire family, and throughout multiple relationships of mine! Food is amazing, fair prices for the portion sizes, and the dessert is superior to anything I’ve ever had. The service is always great and friendly, I’ve never had a rude waiter here. The rare times things have gone wrong, the server always fixed it right away and management never has to get involved. In my opinion this is the best restaurant in Columbus. Best of all, it is family friendly while also having a great selection of beers and bar food. The menu is the perfect size, with an option for everyone. Large parties are accommodated well, and they are good at keeping wait times minimal.

The worst dining experience I've ever encountered. Nearly all the food is processed, very low quality, and price hiked. One of the meals wasn't even properly cooked. It's astonishing this place is still in business. The bartenders and a handful of staff were hard-working, but the majority of the workers seemed disengaged. I've seen Fast Food places run more smooth, and taste way better too. The CEO should be ashamed serving TV dinner quality food at restaurant prices. If you work here I'd recommend looking to work at a higher class establishment. You guys honestly can't be proud serving that menu or eating that food. Dissatisfied doesn't even begin to describe the entire experience of this place and their Facebook reviews are some of the worst I've seen. Across the whole country. Have some decency and serve your fellow citizens healthy and clean food. Shame on you.

I placed a takeout order of Enlightened Seared Ahi Salad (see attached picture) today for dinner. Once I got home, I opened my bag and didn't see any sauce for my salad. Moreover, they didn't even give me any fork to eat it with. I live half an hour away from the restaurant so there is no way for me to waste more time and gas just to go back there again and ask for my sauce that was supposed to come with my salad.
